title.rendered: What is Thin Content in SEO: How To Avoid Thin Content

content.rendered:
Thin content is of little use or no use to the readers and It can cause significant damage to your website or blog.

We write articles to generate traffic so that we can achieve our goal. Users read articles to gain valuable information. 

Thin content does not satisfy the purpose of the reader and the blogger. 

We will explain why it’s crucial to avoid thin content and how you can ensure that your website isn’t cluttered with thin content in this article. This will be beneficial for both visitors and search engines.


What is Thin Content?

Content is considered thin if it does not provide the reader with useful and meaningful information. It may be a form of low word count or insufficient depth, which fails to add value to reading. 

The main object of search engines is to provide the user with the most relevant and valuable information. Thin content does not align with this objective.

For more information about thin content you can check google spam policies.

Why Thin Content is Damaging

Several factors affect our blog’s success. If we have put all our efforts into SEO but our content is thin and does not provide value to visitors, then all our efforts will go in vain. following are damaging effects of thin content.

Bad for SEO

In the old days, when competition was less, even thin content could rank. But we know now, that there is a lot of content on the Internet, so search engines want to provide the best quality content to their users. To prevent low-value content, they penalize websites with thin content.

User Experience

With the increased availability of content, users need high-quality content. Users have more options, they leave a website if they find low-quality content. 

Credibility and Authority

Thin content is not good for a website’s credibility and authority.


The characteristics of a thin content

Thin content can be identified with the help of a few points.

Low Word Count

Content that has a higher word count is considered good because it requires more words to give a deeper explanation of a topic. Pages with fewer words struggle to convey meaningful information.

More word count may be considered as a parameter that indicates that content has depth.

Google also considered it a factor in finding valuable content.

Shallow Information

Thin content is defined as content that only outlines the problem and does not provide in-depth insights with solutions.

Avoid Repetition in Content

When there is a repetition of the same or similar information on multiple pages, content is considered duplicate. Such pages are categorized by search engines as having duplicate content.

Publishing the same or similar content on multiple pages within the website is considered duplicate content.

If we copy other people’s content without adding value to it, it is also considered duplicate content, and it is called scraped content. 

Content that is taken from another website and slightly modified without adding any original content is called scraped content.

Google can penalize our website for duplicate content.

Irrelevance Content

The content is created solely for search engines and does not match the user’s intended purpose. This type of content is referred to as thin content. It is detrimental to the user experience and results in a lower ranking on the website.

AI Generated Content Without Value

Content is generated by tools that stuff information without human refining. The accuracy or authenticity of information may not be accurately represented by such content. These tools gather information from the Internet, which may sometimes be incorrect. AI-generated content that lacks human-like value results in thin content, which wastes user time.

Automated Content

Webmasters sometimes use a tool to generate content based on user queries, but it doesn’t provide value and just alters the query. This is also called thin content.


How to Address Thin Content

To prevent thin content, there are a few things to keep in mind.

Write content with Enough Words

Writing more words in content is essential, but in certain circumstances, it is not possible to write a large amount of content. Don’t use words that are irrelevant or repetitive when explaining something properly.

For example, on an e-commerce website, it is not possible to have large content for all products. To address this problem, compose appropriate content for each page that may be universal for all products in a product segment. Writing for every product is not required. The specifications and description of each product are different, this is used to add uniqueness to the content.

Content Quality

Don’t sacrifice content quality to increase the quantity. Write informative and engaging content for the reader.

Be cautious of content that is high in volume but low in value. The user experience suffers and SEO is negatively affected.

Original and Unique Content

Write your content, which is unique. By obtaining information from old content and adding value to it, you can make it unique and fresh.

Duplicate Content

Don’t repeat information within website pages. Make sure to write only one post for a single keyword.

To avoid duplicate content, avoid copying content from other websites. If you’re required to write a post on the same topic, make sure to add value to it and provide extensive information.

Write for the User

Content should not be written solely for SEO purposes. The readers will leave your website soon and Google will rank it lower if our content is not user-friendly and engaging. 

Keep Content Fresh

Keep your content updated by regularly auditing your website’s content, as facts and data change every day. Obsolete content is considered misinformation.

Some Points to Consider

Ensure that your content does not appear thin. The user may perceive your good content as thin if it is not presented properly. It’s important to structure your content properly. Use short paragraphs because some readers have short memories, and long content can prevent them from grasping the concept. The use of titles to break up the content into smaller parts aids in the user’s memory retention. Additionally, incorporate images to illustrate your content.

Conclusion

In a high competition, there is a lot of content on the internet, so there is no place for thin content. Thin content affects your website’s search engine ranking. It is very bad for the user experience, which is also bad for our website’s SEO.

In this article, you have learned how to identify thin content and remove it.

By removing thin content, you can build a blog or website with a great online presence with search engines and a target audience.

title.rendered: How to Choose a Web Host: 10+ Technical Points

content.rendered:
Hosting is a foundation for a website or blog. To know How to Choose a Web Host, we must be familiar with technical terms, to save time and money.

It is important to know how to choose a web host that fulfill your needs. Choosing the best web hosting service is the initial step in starting an e-commerce website or blog.

Many factors must be considered when purchasing hosting.

In this article, we will go over each factor one by one to assist you in choosing a hosting company, hosting type, and hosting plan.

Although many questions may be confusing, this article will help you decide which hosting is suitable for you.

Why is It Important to Choose a Host Wisely?

Choosing a web hosting provider that is suitable for our needs is crucial when starting a website or blog.

Hosting is the main factor that determines website speed. Our SEO will be negatively impacted by slow website speed. The search engine’s crawl rate is also impacted by it.

We can handle other technical problems on our own, but hosting that isn’t carefully selected could cause us difficulties. Our only option is to switch hosting providers. 

Changing hosting is a laborious task. Changing hosting requires us to spend money and waste time.

Some hosting providers provide free hosting facilities. But changing hosting increases our workload.

So, If we choose web hosting carelessly, many issues may arise.

How to Choose a Web Host Best for Your Website

While we can handle any technical issues on our end, hosting that isn’t carefully chosen could cause us trouble. When choosing a hosting service for your website or blog, keep these factors in mind.

Loading Speed 

Hosting speed determines our website loading speed. Before buying hosting, it’s essential to consider hosting speed as the most important factor. It is crucial for SEO and traffic.

Many factors affect hosting speed, so we need to consider all of them.

Storage Types

It is crucial to choose the right hosting with the right storage type for your website. The type of storage used affects the speed of hosting.

Below is a list of storage types and their speed.

HDDs

HDDs are the old type of memory drive. Although they are cheaper than other storage types, they are also very slow.

For blogs and websites that need fast loading speeds, HDD storage hosting is not recommended as it is very slow. They are ideal for large storage, but not for speed.

SSDs

SSDs are solid-state drives. The speed of these is nearly 10 times faster than that of HDDs.

Because they do not have any moving parts for read-and-write operations. So it takes less time for read and write operations, which makes them faster. For websites and blogs, hosting with SSD storage is considered the best.

NVMe

NVMe’s full name is Non-Volatile Memory Express (NVMe). The speed of NVMes is 6 times faster than that of SSDs. This combines the features of SSDs and HHDs, such as speed and storage capacity. 

However, NVMe is very expensive. Hosting with NVMe carries a high cost.

After discussing the three types, we can conclude that SSD storage hosting is the best option for blogs or websites.

So choose hosting that uses SSDs. It is both cost-effective and fast. NVMe may be an option if you want to spend more money.

Content Delivery Network (CDN)

To deliver content, Content Delivery Networks (CDN) employ groups of servers. The server, located near the client, delivers content.

This technique reduces the distance between the server and the client, which increases the loading speed of the website.

It’s recommended to choose a hosting provider that offers CDN hosting services.

Uptime

The importance of hosting uptime cannot be overstated. It’s a major setback when someone clicks on our link or wants to access our website, but the hosting server is down. It indicates to the visitor that the website is not genuine, and they will not revisit it. It also irritates the visitor and negatively affects their user experience.

It is also observed by Google and is considered negative for SEO. Our hard work may be adversely affected by this.

The measurement of uptime is in percentages. This is the amount of time a website operates without any server failure; it can fluctuate from lower to full 100% time.

When the uptime is above 99%, it is considered good.

Storage Space 

To store your website or blog files and database, storage is necessary. Website storage doesn’t matter if your website is static. If your website is dedicated to blogging, news, CMS, pictures, audio, video, uploading, and downloading, it will require more space.

If your site is small, you can opt for a less expensive hosting plan with limited storage. however, it should be possible to upgrade to a larger plan that has more space.

The majority of hosting services offer unlimited space. If that’s the situation, that’s good. Just examine other factors like the number of files, data transfer limit, etc.

Inodes Limit

The maximum number of files you can store on the server is called the inode limit. If the total number of inodes reaches the limit, even with unlimited storage space, you can not upload more files to your website. 

You can not exceed the number of inodes, this means you can not upload more pictures, video files, or any other type of files.

It is good for you to choose a hosting that allows more files to be saved.

Data Transfer

It is monthly traffic allowed to the website by the hosting server. The server will cease to show your website if it reaches the traffic limit mentioned in the plan. 

Almost all hosting plans specify a data transfer limit. There are hosting companies that provide unlimited data transfer, which means there is no limit to the maximum amount of traffic.

To avoid reaching the maximum limit, purchase hosting from a company that offers an unlimited plan.

Security 

When choosing hosting, security is also a factor that we must consider. The lack of security can lead to the loss of our data, which can be detrimental to our blog or website. 

Data security 

Data security is the most important aspect of a hosting service. A good hosting service uses all means to protect your website data, including databases and website structure files. The following means are used to enhance data security.

  • Backups
  • Include storage redundancy (Raid-10 Storage)
  • Block web attacks
  • Automatic virus scanner
  • Machine Learning Firewall
  • In-House Malware Database

 All these are important for data safety. Prevent your website from any mishaps.

SSL Certificates

SSL encryption is essential for security and to enhance the user experience by making visitors feel secure. The secure transfer of data using encryption requires SSL certificates. 

Most of the hosting companies provide free SSL Certificates.

Spam Filtering

Spam filters help to prevent hackers from overloading resources.

Easy Installation of CMS and Other Software

It is necessary to have the ability to easily install apps, CMS, and shopping carts like WordPress, Joomla, Drupal, PrestaShop, Magee, and Mambo. Almost every hosting company provides the ability to install all of these in cPanel with ease. It’s important to make sure that the hosting provider has a dedicated interface for installing the software you want to install.

Customer Support

It is always necessary to have good customer support. If the hosting company has good customer support, you can reach out to them immediately when you encounter any technical problems with your website.

Their response and quickness in resolving your problem are included in it.

To communicate instantly, a good support service offers an online chat system.

The second place goes to the ticked service, and the email service takes longer.

Before buying hosting, you can check hosting service support reviews online or ask someone who has already purchased before making a purchase.

Go for a hosting service that offers good customer service.

Conclusion 

A hosting serves as a crucial foundation for a website or blog. To attract more customers, hosting providers create unique customized plans in this highly competitive environment. Knowing technical terms can help you save time and money. Additionally, you can obtain the most reliable hosting for your website or blog to ensure steady performance.

This article provides technical information that can help you select a hosting service that meets your needs.

I believe this article will help you learn how to Choose a web host.

title.rendered: 45+ Amateur Blogging Mistakes Beginners

content.rendered:
Preventing amateur blogging mistakes beginners can help increase traffic to your blog and prevent Google penalties. It’s important to be aware of blogging mistakes and either eliminate them or implement strategies to prevent them.
The purpose of this article is to provide you with information on amateur blogging mistakes to prevent yourself from being harmed by them, whether you are aware or not.

What are the Amateur Blogging Mistakes

Amateur blogging mistakes are made by beginners who are ignorant or committed to increasing traffic by using tactics without understanding the negative consequences. 

Low knowledge leads beginners to make blogging mistakes, which are also known as amateur blogging mistakes 

The main cause of these amateur mistakes is due to ignorance or a lack of knowledge.

We categorized these blogging mistakes into sections.

Content Quality

Following blogging mistakes can degrade your content quality. it is important to avoid blogging mistakes about content to rank your site.

Copied Content

It’s a bad idea to copy content from another website. If you don’t add any value to the content you research on the internet, it will be considered copied. Plagiarism is a term used to describe it. Google is capable of detecting such content, and once it detects it, it will penalize your content.

AI-Generated Content

AI creates content by obtaining information from the internet, which includes content that has already been published on the internet. Publishing such content on the internet does not add value.

Do not waste time uploading such content to your website. Although it may increase your website’s impression, it will be penalized after detection. This is not a bet that can last for a long time.

Clickbait Content

The purpose of clickbait content is to entice users to click without fulfilling their expectations.

Without understanding the visitor’s purpose, it’s not a good idea to add content only for clicks. The user’s engagement rate will be decreased by this.

Errors in Writing And Difficult To Read Content

The quality of your content can suffer due to grammatical and spelling mistakes. The content becomes difficult to read as a result of decreased readability. It is possible that it could be the reason for your blog’s failure. 

Long Paragraphs

The reader gets annoyed by long paragraphs, and they don’t want to read them because they are scared of reading for a long time.

It’s best to break up the content into short paragraphs and use subheadings at deeper levels. It enhances the article’s readability and encourages reader engagement.

Bad Structure and Unorganized Information

Readers will struggle to understand the article if the information is not logically organized.

It’s important to structure information in a proper way. It is important for a paragraph to give information about a particular point. The article gains value by having paragraphs that are logically connected to each other, which supports the whole piece.

The logical structure makes it easier for readers to understand and develop an interest in the content.

Using a Generic Writing Style

Generic content is undefined. Rather than focusing on explaining its meaning or purpose more deeply, it utilizes a broad approach, which won’t resonate with the reader as well as something more specific.

Outdated Content or Stats Bogging Mistake

Your credibility and blog will suffer if you write outdated content. If you don’t update facts, your content will become outdated. It’s important to verify the accuracy of your facts, as incorrect information can mislead the reader and damage your brand.

leave Unanswered Questions

If your content fails to answer the query that brought the reader to your article, they will leave your blog and not return. Your reader will be lost forever. Make sure to never leave unanswered questions in the blog.

Redundant Content

The article loses the reader’s attention due to the repetition of information. Every time the reader reads a new line, it must give some new information that will engage the reader for further reading. Failure to do so can result in boredom for the reader and their departure from your website.

Publish Posts Only to Follow a Schedule

Quality should not be sacrificed for the sake of publishing at specific intervals. Low-quality content will only waste your time and not help you. To enhance the quality of the content, spend more time revising and refining it.

Creating only Seasonal Content

Creating content solely about trending events can lead to a short-term increase in your blog traffic. To consistently receive traffic, you must put in a lot of effort. Evergreen content has the potential to bring us steady traffic.

Not Adding Value, But Promoting or Selling Services

If you solely write for your own purposes without adding valuable content, users won’t return to your website. Solving your reader’s problem and presenting your service as a helpful solution in a fair manner will be beneficial.

Optimizing The Content

It is very important to optimize content for SEO purposes.

Ignoring the Importance of Images

Images are very important in text content, One image speaks a thousand words. The image develops visual appeal in your content by dividing content. It helps to create a perception in the reader’s mind of small content with more value.

It also decorates your content and makes it colorful, which helps engage readers with your content.

Overlooking the Significance of the Headline and Description

The click-through rate (CTR) is greatly influenced by the title and description. Your blog’s ranking on search engine result pages (SERPs) will be higher if it has quality content that provides value to users. If the user doesn’t click your link on the SERP, everything is pointless.

If your description doesn’t attract users, they won’t click on the link and your CTR will be very low. So, take care of your title and write a description that describes your content for which query brings your blog to SERP.

If you do not provide a description, Google will automatically generate one, which may or may not be satisfactory.

Both headline and description have a direct impact on our click-throw rate (CTR). Without researching the title and description or not adding focus keywords, visitors won’t click the website link and your hard work will be lost.

Optimize The Same Keyword On Multiple Pages

This is a one of Amateur Blogging Mistakes, If we use the same keyword on multiple pages, blog posts will compete with each other for search engine rankings. This is called “keyword cannibalization”.

Concentrate all your efforts on optimizing one keyword on a single page. Create a single page with all the content related to a particular keyword.

Create content without conducting keyword research

Publishing content without conducting keyword research is a waste of time. You can choose low-volume keywords, but it’s not a good idea to write content without a keyword.

The quality of the content is irrelevant if it has not been written for a keyword that is searched on search engines.

Find a keyword and determine its volume, difficulty level, and scope for ranking.

Content Promotion

It is a big blogging mistake to overlook promotion. Search engines are the major source of traffic. By not using other means of promotion you can miss an opportunity to capture a chunk of traffic.

Writing Content, But Not Promoting It

Writing and promoting content are equally important. Attracting traffic to your blog is essential for its growth. Email marketing, forums, and social media are all ways to promote your blog.

Not Utilizing Other Methods of Promotion

Occasionally, we depend on search engines to obtain traffic. Obtaining traffic solely from search engines is a significant challenge for a new blog.

Social media platforms like Instagram, Facebook, Pinterest (which is also a visual search engine), LinkedIn, and others can be used to generate traffic.

Getting traffic from search engines requires ranking our website and having backlinks to it. Getting a backlink for a new website is a challenging task. We might be let down by all of these.

On the flip side, social media platforms could aid us in starting to generate traffic and earning money.

Ignoring Email Marketing

It’s a good idea to create an email list. If you don’t have it, your readers won’t have a reminder that you have published new content. An email can be a way to regain lost readers, even if they forget.

Converting readers into customers is crucial. But when visitors come to your blog for the first time, they do not trust you. When you email them and they come back, they may convert into paying customers. Email is an option for you to send offers.

Not Building a Community

Your readers won’t grow if you don’t develop your community.

Refusing Events Invitation

When you have achieved some success, you may be asked to attend events. Refusing to share your knowledge with others in interviews or webinars is a missed opportunity to establish your brand.

Design Issues

Give More Importance to Design Than Performance

You are wrong if you overload WordPress to achieve design and animation effects. Your blog’s speed can be negatively impacted by using heavy themes and JavaScript files for the look and effects.

Your website or blog attracts visitors only if it is ranked in Google’s search engine results pages (SERPs). Google considers core web vitals as the main criteria for ranking a website. Speed is an essential component of core web metrics. Performance should be your top priority.

Blogs benefit from simple and light designs, which are good for gathering information, as flashy designs detract from readability.

Poor Navigation Plan

If your navigation is not logical, visitors may not easily find the required information, which can create a bad user experience and lead them to leave your website.

Develop a navigation and site structure that makes it easier for users to access information. If you want to attract readers with similar information, group it and make it accessible. Avoid creating a menu that is too complex and confusing, as readers may leave the website without seeing it.

Readers won’t waste time on your website and return to Google for searches.

Ignoring the Mobile Version

The only desktop version’s development will hurt your SEO. The website receives more than 53% of its traffic from mobile devices. Google will lower a website’s ranking if it is not optimized for mobile. Google does not want to provide a poor user experience to its mobile users by redirecting them to a non-mobile-friendly website.

To facilitate easy reading of your text on small mobile screens, a mobile-friendly website has a large font size.

Also, pay attention to the background color and font color to ensure easy readability.

Clickable elements like links, buttons, and menus require more space than desktop versions.

Not Choosing the Appropriate Theme

Choosing a theme without paying attention to basic things can have an impact on our blog’s SEO and traffic.

As previously mentioned, a heavy theme is not advisable. Additionally, there are some other considerations we should take into account.

It is important to select a theme that matches the niche. When choosing a theme for a blog, it’s important to choose one that is simple, clean, and improves readability. It’s beneficial to be light.

Industry can be used to narrow down the selection. Blogging styles vary when it comes to different types of blogging, such as tourism, pets, food, news, and technology. To design a theme, the theme developer considers all aspects of a niche. Decide on a theme that is tailored to your market segment.

Excessive Use of Plugins

The presence of plugins that work on the front end can cause blogs to be heavy and hurt website speed. It makes fault detection more difficult by complicating operations and interfering with each other’s operations. It also makes operations complicated and sometimes interfaces with each other work, making it harder to find faults. Use the plugin only when it is required. 

The External Link Opens in The Current Tab

External links have a positive impact on SEO and user experience. But always make sure that external links open in a new tab. If you don’t do this, Users will find it harder to come back, and they will leave your website. you’ll lose your readers.

Technical Aspects

Ignoring Blog Performance

It is very important to analyze your blog data regarding traffic. Be aware of the keywords that perform the best and enhance their value. The taste of your readers can be revealed by performing keywords, so make sure to write for them with more quality.

Examine traffic sources like devices and countries, KPIs (key performance indicators), and conversion rates.

Ignoring The Core Web Vitals

Our reader engagement and SEO will be negatively impacted if you disregard the accessibility rule. To enhance readability, it is necessary to set font size, font color, and background color contrast according to the accessibility rule. Having the appropriate space between elements makes it easy to click them without any difficulty.

Low-Speed hosting

It will negatively affect your blog’s SEO if your website takes longer to load on the client’s browser. Website loading speed is a significant factor in our SEO. Buying shared hosting at the start is a good idea, but once your blog has a lot of traffic, it’s necessary to upgrade the hosting.

Broken Links

Our website’s SEO may be negatively affected by broken links. It is bad for the user experience. Our credibility is undermined by it, creating an unprofessional image of our brand, and causing visitors to leave our website or blog and never come back.

Establishing Faith And Developing Professional Image

Posts are Published in an Inconsistent Manner

To maintain flow and motivation, it’s important to publish posts consistently. Your regular reader will be enticed by the new and fresh content. Your blog will be forgotten by your readers if you take a long break. Your readers will become accustomed to visiting your blog regularly as a result of regular posting.

Neglecting the Blog’s reputation

The measurement of blog reputation must be based on facts that are genuine, authentic, and verified. False or misleading information can have a negative impact on the blog’s reputation. Your readers’ trust will be affected and they will never come back to your blog.

Preventive Measures

Ignoring Security and Backups

Not taking security and backup seriously is hazardous. Prevention is more effective than cure. Without security, hackers can compromise your website and cause serious problems. It also negatively affects your SEO.

The default Login Page

You cannot imagine how devastating would be if you accidentally delete something important or if an attacker attacks your website. If you don’t back up your database, your data could be damaged, resulting in the loss of all your hard work.

Before making updates and modifications, make sure to take a backup. Adding a plugin or a faulty update can cause compatibility issues and damage your design and work. Restoring your website to its original state in a few minutes is possible if you have taken backups. If not, it could take a considerable amount of time to configure all the settings and a significant amount of money to recover your blog.

We sometimes ignore it because we believe it won’t happen to us, but once it does, we can’t do anything.

It’s important to take the necessary security measures and back up your website regularly.

Complete guide: For detailed information on how to create your WordPress and take backups, see this tutorial.

Bad Ethics That Penlize Blog

Sell or Buy Link

To gain backlinks, it is not recommended to buy, sell, or exchange links on social media. Google’s algorithms are smart enough to detect these scams and punish your blog.

Having backlinks is crucial. Adding quality content to your blog and writing valuable and related guest posts is a way to obtain quality backlinks.

To attract natural backlinks, it’s important to incorporate statistics, new and fresh information, and knowledge into your blog.

Email Spamming

Spamming is an undesirable behavior. Your readers may become annoyed and block you, leading to a loss of customers.

Sending emails regularly is acceptable, but not more than sufficient. Send an email whenever there is new content or an offer for your readers. Send emails to readers that are relevant to their interests, not randomly.

Ignoring Spam Policies

Preventing your blog from receiving Google penalties requires knowing about spam policies. There is a possibility that bloggers may be unaware of these and face penalties.

Cloaking

Cloaking is misleading search engines and users by optimizing a page for one thing but showing another thing on the page. For example, a user clicks on a link on the search engine result page for health issues, but when he reaches the page, it shows information about discouraging shoes.

Doorways

Using multiple domains or pages as a funnel to direct to a single page Making multiple websites with similar URLs and home pages to capture all queries of a specific type

Hacked content

Websites have hacked content because of poor security. It harms target devices by spewing malicious code.

Hackers inject code, pages, content, and hidden links, or redirect pages to hacked websites.

Hidden text and links

Hidden text is only seen by search engines, which are used to remain at a query on search but not have any business with the user. for example, text with white color on a white background.

Keyword stuffing

To improve ranking, use a keyword in content without relevance. Creating a fake list to add keywords repeatedly, a fake block of text with keywords

The addition of unnatural keywords for raking is considered keyword stuffing.

Links spam

Buy, sell, or exchange links to improve rank in search engine results pages.

Backlink from a low-quality directory and bookmark site. Spreading links in Website footers or widgets, through link generation programs, in comments, etc.

It also includes links to low-quality content on websites.

Misleading functionality

Misleading users to search ranking Getting more clicks moves users from one page to another in a complex manner without presenting the intended content. For example, the promise of downloading software, moving the user from one page to another and presenting other software in the process

Scraped content

Scraped content is content that is copied from other websites without any added value. It also violates copyright law. Even if a website publishes copied content citing the source, it is considered scraped content if it has no value.

Spam can include machine-generated traffic, sneaky redirects, spam automatically-generated content, thin affiliate pages, websites with malware, and malicious behaviors.

Read Google guidelines to learn more about spam policies in detail.

Giving Up Soon

If aspiring bloggers are unable to make rapid progress, they may leave after some time, which is the most regrettable mistake. Getting a blog up and running takes time; once it’s up and running, it’s straightforward, but it’s challenging in the beginning.

Conclusion

In this article, we have listed amateur blogging mistakes that we have found that may harm your blog growth if not corrected in time.
We hope this article helps you to remove common amateur blogging mistakes from your blog to achieve the goal of better SEO.

title.rendered: WordPress Password Protect Page: 1 Native Method + Plugin

content.rendered:
Sometimes we need to protect our WordPress website posts or pages from public access. A WordPress password protect page is a simple way to prevent access to these pages.

The creation of a WordPress password protect page for our website is a simple task. In this article, we will provide detailed explanations step by step.

We will create a WordPress password protect page with and without the plugin.

Why Create WordPress Password Protect Page.

Password protection is a feature that allows you to restrict access to your page or post content to only authorized individuals.

Using a password-protected page is a good idea for several reasons.

Sometimes we need to display our content to users who have subscribed to our services or registered on our website.

It is also helpful to protect the downloaded files. To provide support to our customers regarding software downloads, we can create a WordPress password protect page. We can provide a link to the download file from the password-protected WordPress page. If we provide a link to download the file through the WordPress password-protect page, we can protect it by only giving access to people who have paid for it.

Such a download file may not be crucial, but by using WordPress password protection, we can prevent unwanted downloads that prevent overloading our WordPress website.

By using the WordPress password protect page, we can restrict traffic from pages that are only for specific people or groups.

If a page is not fully functional or in progress and we want to test it, we can make it a WordPress password-protected page.

How to Add WordPress Password Protect Page Without Plugin

Creating a password-protected page in WordPress is an easy and simple task. First, we will add a post or page in the Gutenberg editor, then we will add the password to that page or post.

To Create a Password Protected Page in WordPress Follow the Steps below

1 Go to the left side pan in the WordPress dashboard, and click Pages.

2 Click the Add New Page.

3 Enter the page title.

4 Select Summary.

5 Now click Visibility.

6 Now select the radio button Password protected.

7 Enter your password for the page or post.

8 Click Publish.

Now your page has become password protected. You can add the page to the menu.

When you open password password-protected page it will ask for a password before displaying content.

How to Password Protect WordPress Site Using Plugin

Password-protecting our posts or pages can be done easily and quickly by using inbuilt password protection. However, it has limited options for safeguarding implementation. It is not possible to customize protection to meet your needs.

If you want to customize your options, you can use a plugin for password-protected pages and posts. In the upcoming section, we will provide instructions on how to use a plugin for password-protected pages and posts.

In this tutorial we will use the PPWP – Password Protect Pages plugin.

Install and Activate the Password Protect Page Plugin

Follow the steps below to install the WordPress Password Protect Page Plugin.

1 In the left pan of the WordPress dashboard click Plugins.

2 Now click Add New. 

3 Search Password Protected.

4 Click Install Now, and after installation click Activate.

How to Setup of PPWP – Password Protect Pages plugin

The general setting of the PPWP plugin

1 In the left pan of the WordPress dashboard click Password Protect WordPress. By default, Settings are selected, keep it selected.

2 Now Select General.

3 By default post type page and post type post is selected. You can select any other type of custom post type using Post Type Protection. 

4 Cookie Expiration Time is used to set the time for cookies. When some successfully log into the page, browser saves the user’s data in cookies. We can set this option when this data is experienced and the user has to login again on the page.

5 Whitelisted Role option used to set user role which needs no password to view the content of the page. 

If we left it selected No one, then all types of users need to log in to the password-protected page.

6 Password Protect Child Page option only works in the pro version. This option allows you to protect all pages which are children of the main or parent page.

7 Protected Content Visibility lets you show how protected content is in RSS feeds.

8 This option allows not to include password password-protected page from this list. You can add or remove pages. 

9 This option is also used not to include pages from this list. You can add or remove pages.

Setting up Advanced Option

10 Show Post Excerpt option used to show customize except for password protected page. Visitors can see this excerpt when come to this page.

11 Unlock Protected Content without Page Refresh option allows to use of Ajax to display the page without refreshing the page.  

12 Click the Save Change button to save all changes. Otherwise, your change will lost.

Creating Master Passwords

Here you can create a master password that can unlock all individual pages, partial content on the pages, and custom post type, etc. 

13 Select Master Passwords. 

14 Click Add New and you will see a form popup with an input field, fill in your master password. After filling all fields click Add New.

Troubleshooting options

In this option, you can select the following options.

Entire site: This option allows password protect WordPress site entirely. If you select to protect the entire website, your website requires visitors to enter a password whenever they visit any pages. 

If you’re in the process of creating content for your new website and feel it’s not yet ready to be published, it may be beneficial to protect the entire site with a password.

You can view the website after entering the correct password.

Individual Content: this option is used if we want to protect individual posts and pages.

ACP & WordPress Custom fields: this option is used to protect Advanced Custom Fields in WordPress.

Part of Content: this option is used if we want to protect partial content on a post or page.

Partial Protection Using Short-code

1 In the left pan of the WordPress dashboard in the Password Protect WordPress options click Partial Protection.

2 By default General is selected, keep it selected.

3 Click the button to use Short-code.

4 Click the Save Changes button.

Site-wide Protection (Password Protect WordPress Site)

1 In the left pan of the WordPress dashboard in Password Protect WordPress options click Site-wide Protection.

2 Click the Password Protect Entire Site option.

3 Enter the password for your website protection.

4 Click the Save Change button. 

Integration of reCAPTCHA

1 In the left pan of the WordPress dashboard in Password Protect WordPress options click Integration.

2 By default reCAPTCHA, keep it selected.

3 Now select Enable Google reCAPTCHA Protection.

4 In this field select the type of reCAPTCHA, The options are reCAPTCHA v3, reCAPTCHA v2 checkbox, and reCAPTCHA v2 invisible.

5 Choose the form of password to apply reCAPTCHA. 

6 Click the Save Change button.

5 Select the Configuration option to configure reCAPTCHA.

How to Add WordPress Password Protect Page Using Plugin

 First, create a page or post you want to make a WordPress password-protected page.

Now follow the steps below.

1 Add the page or post title.

2 In the option Password protect WordPress click Edit.

3 Select Role, the role may be global, administrator, editor, author, contributor, subscriber

If you select administrator then only the administrator role person can access this page. If you want that anyone can access the page using a password then select global in the role field.

4 Enter the Password for the page.

5 You can select more than one type of role for a particular page as we already have made administrator and subscriber role types.

6 After filling title, content and selecting options click Publish.

Conclusion

Password protection on WordPress websites is a very useful option for security. By using a password, you have the ability to protect your content or limit access.

Password-protecting a WordPress site is an option to restrict users but not search engines.

The purpose of this article was to teach you how to implement and customize password protection options on a WordPress site. We have implemented protection using a plugin as well as the native features of WordPress.

We hope this article helps you password-protect your WordPress pages, posts, or entire website.

title.rendered: WordPress Dashicons and Bootstrap Icons Use As WordPress Icons

content.rendered:
WordPress Icons are very helpful to improve the user experience and look of the WordPress website. There are free resources like WordPress Dashicons and Bootstrap icons to use on WordPress websites.

Dashicons and bootstrap icons are ideal for interface elements due to their simplicity and cleanliness. The two-dimensional views and one-color (monochromatic) appearance make them easy and quick to understand.

In this article, we will explain how to access SVG icons and use them on our WordPress website.

Why Use Bootstrap Icons or WordPress Dashicons?

By improving the visual appeal of the website, icons help to engage visitors. The website attracts more visitors who spend more time on it.

Icons are used to emphasize specific information that needs to be highlighted and make finding it easier.

The consistency of elements and sections can be enhanced by having unique icons in a theme or on our website.

The visual language used by icons is recognized by users and they consistently convey a message. The user interface, various actions, elements, and features in WordPress are effectively represented by them.

The use of WordPress icons aids in creating a link between information and images in the user’s mind, allowing them to recognize specific sections or elements and their names, which aids in easy navigation.
The user experience is enhanced by all these things, resulting in improved SEO.

What are WordPress Dashicons?

WordPress Dashicons are high-quality SVG icons. SVG files are two-dimensional scalable vector graphics that are saved in XML format.

WordPress started to include Dashicons as a native feature since version 3.8, and the number of these SVG icons is 300.

Dashicons are scalable, mean their size can be increased or decreased without losing quality. They support lossless compressions, interactivity, and animation.
Advanced effects and animations can be added to SVGs with the use of CSS or JavaScript.

These are very suitable for a website because of their small size and high resolution. These do not affect website speed as they are lightweight.

In fact, Dashicons are included in Dashboard menu items, but you can also use them on your website’s front-end pages for themes, Gutenberg block editors, and plugins.

In this article, we will explain how to use Dashicon easily on the WordPress website front end.

How to Use Dashicons in WordPress

By default, Dashicons are included in WordPress admin but these are not enabled on the front end and can not used in the themes. To use Dashicons in WordPress, first, you need to enable Dashicons for the current theme that you are using. The second step is to use the theme in your theme.

In this article, we will help you do this in easy steps. 

Enabling Dashicon in the WordPress theme

To enable Dashicons in WordPress, you have to add some code to the functions.php file of your theme.

To enable WordPress Dashicons follow the steps below.

By default, Dashicons are enabled in admin, but you have to enable it in the front end.

1 Go to the left side pan in the WordPress dashboard, and click Appearance.

2 Click the Theme File Editor.

3 Now you will see the Edit Themes screen. Now search for the functions.php file in the right pan of the Edit Themes screen. Click functions.php to edit the file.

4 Add the following code snippet at the bottom of your functions.php file as shown in the picture.

5 Now click the button Update the File to save the code you have added, otherwise all changes will be lost.

Now Dashicons are enabled in your current theme and you can use them anywhere on your website.

How to Add Dashicons to your WordPress website.

After enabling Dashicons you can use Dashicons on your website, but you need the code of a specific icon and to insert that code in your WordPress website. 

Getting Dashicons Code for specific icons.

The second step is to get HTML or CSS code to paste to show these icons. For that, go to wordpress.org and get the code.

Visit the link https://developer.wordpress.org/resource/dashicons/ to get the code of WordPress Dahicons.

1 Search the Dashicons in this search box. Or you can find the icon just by browsing the icon collection. For example, we searched for an archive icon to use on the website.

2 You can see a collection of arrow icons has appeared, click the icon you need. We selected the archive.

3 Select copy CSS or copy HTML to get the code of the icon. We selected copy HTML.

4 Copy the HTML code to use on your website. 

5 Just click OK, to close the pop-up.

You can repeat the process to get more code for more icons. 

Now we have gotten the code next step is to use this on our website.

Add The Dashicons Code to Display The Icons

Now we will add icons to archive list title in the WordPress sidebar.

Follow the steps below.

1 Go to the left side pan in the WordPress dashboard, and click Appearance.

2 Click the Widgets.

3 We have to add an icon to the Archive title. Click the Archives.

4 Now click three vertical dots.

5 Select the Edit as HTML.

6 Add the code we have gotten from wordpress.org for the archive icon. Insert the code between the h2 tag. 

Note: We can add the icon code, in the page, posts, and block, where we want to appear the icon. 

7 Now click Edit visually, to return to the visual editor.

8 To save inserted code and other changes click Update.

9 You can see that the Archive icon appeared on the front page in front of the Archive post title.

Customize Dashicon Using CSS

We can customize Dashicons according to our design needs. We can change the size, color, margins, and padding, and add borders to our Dashicons using CSS. Here you will learn how to add custom CSS code to customize Dashicons.

Follow the steps to customize the Archive icon added in the last section.

1 Go to the left side pan in the WordPress dashboard, and click Appearance.

2 Click the Customize.

3 Select Additional CSS.

4 Add the following code in the box as shown in the picture.

5 Click the Publish button to save the code.

6 You can see that the Dashicons size and color have been changed. Color change from black to white. We have added a 20px margin on the right side. You can that space has been added between the icon and the title

How to Add Bootstrap Icons to your WordPress website.

Bootstrap is an open-source and free-to-use icon library.

There are only 300 icons available in Dashicons. Bootstrap allows for more versatility due to its library of over 2000 high-quality icons.

To use the bootstrap icon you need the code of an icon and to insert that code into your WordPress website. 

Getting Bootstrap Icons Code.

We can get HTML or CSS code to use on the website for Bootstrap Icons. Here we will use HTML code.

Visit the Bootstrap Icons website to get the code of bootstrap icons.

1 Search the icon in the search box. Or you can find the icon just by browsing the icon collection. For example, we searched for the Chevron d (Chevron double) icon to use on the website.

2 You can see a collection of Chevron double icons has appeared, click the icon you need. We selected the Chevron-double-right.

3 Click copy to get the HTML code of the icon. 

You can repeat the process to get more code for more Bootstrap Icons.

Now we have copied the code next step is to use this on our website.

Add The Bootstrap Icons Code to Display The Icons

Now we will add Chevron double icons to list titles in the WordPress sidebar.

Follow the steps below.

1 Go to the left side pan in the WordPress dashboard, and click Appearance.

2 Click the Widgets.

3 We have to add an icon to the Archive title. Click the Archives.

4 Now click three vertical dots.

5 Select the Edit as HTML.

6 Add the code we have copied from Bootstrap for the Chevron double. Insert the code between the h2 tag. 

Note: We can add the Bootstrap Icons code, in the page, posts, and block, where we want to appear the icon. 

7 Now click Edit visually, to return to the visual editor.

8 To save inserted code and other changes click Update.

9 You can see that the Chevron double icon appeared on the front page in front of the Archive post title.

Conclusion

WordPress icons play a crucial role in a website. The absence of icons can make a website appear uninteresting and like a plain text document. In addition to their visual appeal, icons can enhance click-through rates (CTR).
In this article, we talked about Dashicons and Bootstrap icons, which are both free resources that we can use on our website.
We have clarified the process of accessing and displaying WordPress Icons on the WordPress website.
We hope this article will help you use icons on your website.

  • What is a Slug in WordPress: Change and Optimize WordPress Slug

title.rendered: How to Create a Table of Contents in WordPress: 2 Methods and the Best Plugins

content.rendered:
Writing lengthy blog posts is advantageous for SEO purposes. It is also necessary to provide a comprehensive explanation of a subject that requires at least 1500 words.

The majority of readers search for specific knowledge in the post, so they skim the article. If they are unable to locate it at first sight, they will exit the website.

To find relevant content in a long article, visitors can find it very helpful to use the table of contents (TOC). Visitors’ engagement with the website is improved by it.

It aids visitors in navigating your blog post and enhances the user experience.

Creating a table of contents for each post in WordPress is a simple task, either by using a table of contents plugin or manually.

In this article, we will demonstrate how to add tables of content to your WordPress website, either manually or with a plugin.

What is the significance of the WordPress Table of Contents?

A table of contents is a useful tool in a blog post to list the main point of the post. By using the Table of Contents, readers who are interested in specific points can access the topic directly.

Easy navigation inside the long post content also improves the user experience. The Table of Contents features bullet points that engage users with the content. This also aids in improving SEO.

Rich content on search engine result pages can also be achieved using it. In the event that a user asks about a specific topic, Google may provide a direct link to the table of contents on your website.

How to Create Table of Contents in WordPress Without Plugin

To add a table of contents to a WordPress post or page follow the steps below.

1 Create a title Table Of Contents (Arrow 1) 

2 Add all the titles of the page h tags under Table of Contents as list components (Arrow 2). 

3 Now go to the first paragraph h tag and place the mouse cursor over the tag as shown in the picture (Arrow 1).

4 Click the three vertical dots (Arrow 2).5 Now click the Edit as HTML (Arrow 3)

6 Add the line id=”what-are-widgets” (Arrow 1). You can add any unique id as id=”xyz”. But remember one thing the value of each ID should be unique for all page tags and the ID value should not have space. We will repeat this process for all paragraph tags of the post or page, that we want to list in the table of contents. 

7 Now click Edit Visually (Arrow 2)

8 Now go to the TOC we have already added. Select a title (Arrow 1).

9 Click the link Icon (Arrow 2)

10 A popup window will open. Add #what-are-widgets in the input box (Arrow 1).

11 Press enter button (Arrow 2).

Now, the Link to the first paragraph title has been added to the TOC.

Repeat the same process step 1 to step 11, and add all paragraph title links to the Table of Contents. 

You can see all the links have been added to the Table of Contents (Arrow 1).  

Your table of contents will be displayed on the website’s front end as shown in the following picture. You can customize it using CSS.

How to Use Easy Table of Contents Plugin

It is easy to add 2 – 3 posts or pages table of contents, but It is a difficult process to add every time Table of Contents to the new post.

To solve the problem we can use a Tabel of Contents plugins. Here we will explain how to add a TOC plugin.

To learn will take an example of Easy Table of Contents plugin

Installing TOC plugin 

Follow the steps below to install the WordPress Table of Contents.

1 In the left pan of the WordPress dashboard click Plugins.

2 Now click Add New. 

3 Search table of contents.

4 Click Install Now, and after installation click Activate.

Table of Contents  Plugin Setting

Settings for the table of contents are divided into sections, we explain them one by one.

General Setting

To generate a table of contents, you need to select posts, pages, or other types in the general setting.

By default, Posts and Pages are selected, but you can also select more options.

Appearance Settings

The appearance setting allows you to adjust Width, Alignment, Wrapping, Headings Padding, Font Option, Title Font Size, Title Font Weight, Font Size, and Child Font Size.

In theme options, you can select Theme Color, Background Color, Border Color, Title Color, Link Color, Link Hover Color, Link Visited Color, Heading Text Direction.

Advance Setting

In the advance settings section, it’s possible to choose options to ensure that anchors are in lowercase. The primary choice is to determine the depth at which we need to insert the tag in TOC. The headings option (h1, h2, h3, h4, h5, h6) can be selected for that purpose.

Although there are many settings, we have made the necessary ones. Once the changes have been made, click the Save Changes button at the bottom.

The purpose of this section is to demonstrate how to install the TOC plugin and make the necessary settings. These settings are nearly identical in all other TOC plugins. It’s similar to setting up other Table of Contents plugins.

Tables of content for your WordPress posts and pages are automatically generated by the Easy Table of Contents plugin. The plugin is easy to use and user-friendly.

WordPress Table of Contents Plugin

Here we list a few plugins for TOC.

Easy Table of Contents plugin

Tables of content for your WordPress posts and pages are automatically generated by the Easy Table of Contents plugin. This plugin is easy to use and user-friendly.

Gutenberg, Classic Editor, Elementor, Divi, WPBakery Page Builder, and Visual Composer page editors can be used with it.

All content inside the template tag ‘_content()’ is linked by it.

You have the option to select a theme based on the style of the table of contents. You have the option to select colors for the border, background, and link color that match your theme and design.

You have the option to choose the position where the Table of Contents is displayed on the post or page. It’s possible to decide which header tag (h) appears in the table of contents. 

Bullet formats like decimal, numeric, and Roman can also be selected.

LuckyWP Table of Contents

LuckyWP Table of Contents Plugin inserts a table of contents automatically in posts and pages. It is an SEO-friendly plugin because it generates TOC that supports Google snippets on the result page. 

It is able to insert the table of contents with a short-code, Gutenberg block, or widget.

You can customize TOC appearance easily by changing width, float, title font size and weight, items font size, and colors. You can set the minimum number of headings to display the table of contents.

Table of Contents Plus

It not only automatically inserts a table of contents in posts and pages but also outputs sitemap listing pages and categories across your WordPress website.

You can include the index in the sidebar. It is very simple to add a TOC index to the sidebar.

Click Appearance then  Widgets Now drag the TOC+ to your desired sidebar and position.

Ultimate Block Plugin

The Ultimate Block plugin is used to add custom blocks to the Gutenberg editor. It also adds a block to the Gutenberg editor that is capable of creating tables of content.

Inserting a table of contents in your post or page is an easy task with the Ultimate Block Plugin. It takes a single click to insert TOC, but it doesn’t do it automatically.

Select the desired position and insert a table of contents block, and the TOC will be generated automatically.

You can customize TOC bullet points, alignment, and number of columns.

You can also remove any header you don’t want to display in the TOC.

The Ultimate Block plugin is useful for WordPress websites with lengthy posts that contain various types of content.

Heroic Table of Contents

Heroic Table of Contents automatically adds TOC to your posts or pages. A TOC generator plugin is available for free.

It is up to you to decide which post headings should be displayed on the target website page.

It allows you to choose from 4 pre-made styles for TOC. It also facilitates a button to expand or collapse the table on the front page.

In lengthy content, you can create multiple TOCs. It is a mobile-friendly and SEO-friendly plugin.

CM Table of Contents

CM Table of Contents plugin generates a customizable table of contents for pages and posts.

You can select which header tag to include in the TOC. Also, you can customize TOC using CSS.

You can change the TOC title, navigation style, and font size. It also has the option to collapse or expand TOC on the page. 

It supports custom post types, long paginated posts, hierarchical or multi-level tables, wrapping the text left or right, selecting the number of columns in the TOC, and displaying a floating table of contents div when the user scrolls. Also, add the button “Back to the Top”  or row.

Conclusion

The table of contents is crucial for the user experience and helps visitors connect with your content.

In this article, we have explained how to add TOC manually or using a TOC plugin.

If your blog is small or you frequently add posts or pages, you can manually add TOC. But in the case of a large post collection, you may have the option to add a TOC using a plugin.

We hope this article helps you to add TOC to your WordPress blog posts.

title.rendered: WordPress Widgets: How to Add Widgets to WordPress + 7 Widget Plugins

content.rendered:
WordPress widgets are ready-made pieces of code used to add additional features to WordPress. With minimal or no coding knowledge, we can add or remove widgets. The widget area is the place where widgets are displayed on the front end.

The use of WordPress widgets can enhance the functionality of a WordPress website and make it more appealing.

Widgets enhance both the user experience and website quality. Ultimately, it is beneficial for SEO.

This article focuses on using WordPress widgets to enhance website usability and the plugin list that has useful widget features.

What are Widgets in WordPress

The purpose of WordPress widgets is to add more functionality to a WordPress website without impacting its content.
The widget provides additional or related information about the content. Examples of widgets are Resent posts, categories, calendars, galleries, social media links, search boxes, and many more.

The widget area is the place where we place widgets or where they appear. It’s possible to situate widgets in the sidebar, header, footer, or even within the content.
It is possible to customize settings to display them on all pages or a specific page.

There are a lot of widgets in WordPress. By default, all widgets are not included in WordPress. To add some features to a WordPress website, we have to use WordPress widget plugins. The creation of a widget is also possible by adding code to funcion.php
Some examples of WordPress widgets, for which we need to install plugins, are Google Maps, phone call facilities, tables of contents, WPForms, and many more.

How to Add Widgets to WordPress

If you have installed WordPress it is very important to learn how to add WordPress widgets to your WordPress website to add more features. 

It is easy to add the widget to your website, Just follow the steps below.

1 In the left pan of the WordPress dashboard click Appearance.

2 Now click Widgets.

Now you will see the Widgets window.

3. This is a list of all widget areas.

For example Right Sidebar, Left Sidebar, Header, Footer Widget 1, Footer Widget 2, and so on. You can choose any widget area to add widgets.

4 Let’s consider we have to add widgets to the widget area Right Sidebar. 

5 Click + sign to open the widget window. (You can also open the widget window by clicking the + sign in the top bar near the Widgets).

6 You can see a list of widgets. You can click any one and it will be added to the widget area.

7 If you have not found the desired widget in the list you can search in the search box. 

8 You can click the Browse All sign to open a large widget window.

Adding Widget To Widget Area

We have understood all about widgets. Now we will learn how to add WordPress widgets to different widget areas. 

Adding Widget To Sidebar

Adding Latest Posts to the Right Sidebar. 

1 Select the Right Sidebar.

2 Click the + sign to open the widget window.

3 Search for the Latest Post in the search box.

4 Now click Latest Posts.

5 Click Update to save the changes.

1 In the next window you can see the latest posts are added to the right sidebar widget area.

2 You can add more widgets to the right sidebar by clicking the + sign.

3 Click Update to save the changes.

Now you can see the latest posts have appeared on the front end of our WordPress website.

Essential WordPress Widgets Plugins for Your Website

WordPress doesn’t come with all widgets by default. Adding additional features to the WordPress website requires the use of WordPress Widget Plugins. For example, Google Maps, phone call facilities, Table of Contents, Contact Forms, and many more.

We have provided a list of essential plugins that can enhance your website’s usability and user experience.

Social Sharing Plugin

Price: free

Downloads: 100000+

Rating: 5/5 

Social Sharing Plugin – Sassy Social Share Plugin helps your website visitors to share your content over Social media platforms. Your website visitors can share content on Linkedin, Twitter, Google, Facebook, Tumblr, WhatsApp, Reddit, Pinterest,  Parker, getter, Gab, and over 110 more social sharing and bookmarking services.

This is easy to set up and the Social Share plugin uses good-looking vector icons.

Call Now Button

Price: Free and Pro

Downloads: 200000+

Rating: 5/5 

The Call Now Button plugin displays a click-to-call button at the bottom of the screen.

By simply clicking this button, your website visitor can call you from their mobile phone. It is a very useful feature because visitors do not need to find a contact or phone number or dial the number to communicate with you.

In the pro version, you can also add buttons for Email, SMS/Text, Phone, WhatsApp, Messenger, Signal, Telegram, Link, Location, Scroll to Point, Skype, Line, Viber, WeChat, Content Window, and Tally Form Window.

WP Go Maps (formerly WP Google Maps)

Price: Free and Pro

Downloads: 400000+

Rating: 5/5 

WP Go Maps plugin is used to create Google Maps on your WordPress website. It also displays a store locator on WordPress pages, posts, and contact page maps.

It also displays routes and delivery area maps.

WP Go Maps is easy to install on a website by using a short code without using iFrames. WP Go Maps also supports map widgets for classic.

Integration of WP Go Maps with Elementor map blocks simplifies the creation of Elementor maps, map blocks, and map widgets.

WP Go Maps free version creates Google Maps with markers without any number limit. The Pro version offers many more options like custom Google maps with high-quality markers containing descriptions, locations, categories, images,  links, and directions.

Easy Table of Contents

Price: Free and Pro

Downloads: 400000+

Rating: 4.5/5 

The Easy Table of Contents plugin automatically generates tables of content for your WordPress posts and pages. It is a very easy-to-use and user-friendly plugin.

It supports the rank math plugin and the <!– next page –> tag. It can work with Gutenberg, Classic Editor, Elementor, Divi, WPBakery Page Builder, and Visual Composer page editors.

It generates links for all content inside the template tag the_content().

You can choose the position where the Table of Contents appears on the post or page. You can also choose a lower limit of h tag to appear in the table of contents. 

You can also choose a theme in terms of bites and the style of the table of contents. You can choose colors for the border, background, and link color according to your theme and design.

You can also choose options for bullet formats such as none, decimal, numeric, and Roman.

The Google Language Translator plugin

Price: Free and Pro

Downloads: 100000+

Rating: 4.5/5 

The Google Language Translator plugin adds a language switch button widget to the WordPress website. This plugin uses the Google Translate service to translate languages. It shows a witch on the website to switch between languages.

It provides a wide range of language translations, including right-to-left script languages like Urdu, Hebrew, and Arabic.

This plugin has free and pro versions. In the free version, it translates posts and pages, WooCommerce shops, categories, and tags.

It also translates WordPress website themes, plugins, menus, and widgets.

It displays a language bar with flags in the menu. Floating language selector, a button to disable Suggest a better translation pop-up and

It has support for Google Analytics integration, a feature to translate the site on the fly,

Google automatic machine translation and the option to hide the Google top frame after translation.

The premium version has more features such as multilingual SEO, enabled search engine indexing, neural machine translations with human-level translation quality, and search-engine-optimized URLs and slug translation.

Yoast SEO compatibility, WooCommerce compatibility, 

translating metadata, translating JSON objects, and translating AMP pages (Accelerated Mobile Pages translation).

Image localization, translation proxy, centralized translation cache, language hosting, user dashboard, and live chat support.

You also have the option to manually correct the translation.

Widget Importer & Exporter

Price: Free and Pro

Downloads: 300000+

Rating: 4.5/5 

Using Widget Importer & Exporter is advantageous for moving widgets from one WordPress site to another. Backing up widgets can be done using it.

Instead of XML, JSON format is used to export files.

The import process involves uploading an export file created by the plugin. A nicely formatted table displays the results of an import.

The JSON export file extension.wie can be generated by the Widget Importer and Exporter. Using this plugin, this file can be imported into other sites or restored widgets to the same site later.

WPform Plugin For Forms

Price: Free and Pro

Downloads: 5,000000+

Rating: 5/5 

WPform is an easy-to-use WordPress plugin to create a WordPress form. It creates a form widget that you can insert into your WordPress website. It allows you to create different types of forms, such as consent forms, subscription forms, online surveys, donation forms, feedback forms, and payment forms.
