title.rendered: How to Install WordPress: 2 Easiest Methods For WordPress Installation

content.rendered:
WordPress is a well-known CMS. This article explains how to Install WordPress step by step.

It is a great platform to create a website without much technical knowledge.

WordPress is used to create and manage various types of websites, such as blogs, e-commerce, online stores, news portals, forums, and more. 

Why Choose WordPress

WordPress dominates over 43% of the market.

The reason why WordPress is a preferred platform is because it is user-friendly, open source, free, and trustworthy.

It is very flexible, you can customize its’ look and capabilities according to our needs using thousands of pre-built themes and plugins. We can also utilize free themes and plugins. 

WordPress has a large community online. You can also customize it by using your own code. There are many tutorials and other materials about WordPress available online. 

WordPress can be installed by almost every hosting company with the click of a button without any technical knowledge. You can also use Wizard to Install WordPress.

To enhance the capabilities of WordPress service, it is possible to install plugins.

How to Install WordPress

You can install WordPress easily by following some steps.

First log in the your website hosting cPanel.

After logging you will see WordPress Dashboard.

Find the Scripts Section, toward the bottom of cPanel.

Now click the WordPress icon shown in the picture below

This will open a new window.

Now Click Install Now.

In the next the window you can fill in your website information.

Enter your domain name and select the Latest version.

Enter your Site Name and Site Description as shown in the picture below.

In the next window fill in your email address and click Install to install WordPress

After clicking Install, It may take a few seconds or a few minutes to Install WordPress. You can now customize your WordPress website to meet your needs.

Customize The WordPress Website by Installing a New Theme

The style and design of a WordPress website or blog are defined by code files and media files that make up a WordPress theme. The WordPress default theme is minimalist.
It’s simple to alter the design of your blog by changing the theme. Choose the theme from the WordPress dashboard, install it, and activate it. The WordPress theme library contains thousands of themes. There are both free and paid themes available.


It’s simple to change the theme at any time. Your website’s appearance will be modified, but the data will remain unchanged. The design of your blog will be altered by a different theme, but the content of your post will stay the same.
The design determines how posts are fitted automatically.


It’s easy to change themes, let’s learn how.
To make changes or create a post, you must log in to the WordPress dashboard.

To access the WordPress Dashboard, enter the URL your-domain.com/wp-admin in the browser bar. Replace your domain.com with your domain name.

You will see this login screen. Enter Username and Password

After successful login, you will see the WordPress Dashboard

Step 1. You can see the Appearance menu in the left sidebar. click Appearance.
Step 2. Window will change, click Add New at the top of the dashboard.

There are many themes to choose from. The task of choosing a theme is challenging because all themes are beautiful. You will be trapped in Squirrel Syndrome.

The Feature Filter button can be used to overcome this situation.

Three vertical columns are visible in the next picture. In the subject column, you can choose any option according to your website type. Available options are Blog, E-Commerce, Education, Entertainment, Food and drink, Holiday, News, Photography, and Portfolio.


In the feature, you can choose according to your preference, for example, a custom head, Accessibility Ready, Block Editor Patterns, Block Editor Styles, Custom Background, Custom Colors, Custom Header, Custom Logo, and many more.

The layout column allows you to choose Grid Layout, One Column, Two Columns, Three Columns, Four Columns, Left Sidebar, Right Sidebar, Wide Blocks as the blog layout.


The themes displayed by these filters are based on the features that were selected. This is a valuable tool for narrowing down your theme options list.

Upon selecting your options, click Apply Filters.

There are several themes that are suitable for your needs.

A quick preview of the theme’s design and look can be obtained by clicking on the theme thumbnail. The demonstration will show how your blog will look after using this theme.

If the theme catches your attention, you can click on the Install button on the top left side of the preview window inside the red box. After the WordPress installation is completed, the Install button will turn into an activate button.

Click the Activate button in the red box in the picture below to activate the theme.

In case the theme doesn’t work for you, you can repeat the process to select a different one.

Blog Theme Customization

After selecting and activating the theme, we must customize it to meet the needs of our blog and make it unique for our domain.
While there are many customization options, we will only discuss the ones that are necessary for a blog. It is mandatory to set up the blog title and logo. Other customization can be made at a later time.

To get started with the customization process, go to Appearance in the left sidebar and click the ‘Customize’ button on your current theme.

The customization screen is shown in the picture below.

The sidebar menu options may differ depending on the theme. The main option that needs to be changed is the ‘Site Identity’.

Select the ‘Site Identity’ option from the left sidebar.

The blog title, tagline, and logo can be added on the next screen.

The picture below shows you how to fill in the information.
Click on ‘Select Logo’ to upload the blog logo. A media library will appear after clicking, where you can upload the logo for your blog or website.

The Logo Size field allows you to adjust the size of the logo.

The next step is to decide on the site title. Enter your blog’s title or name.

After that, fill in the tagline for your blog or business.

Click on Select site icon at the end to upload the icon for your blog or website. This icon is displayed in the browser tab when someone opens your blog or website.

To preserve all changes, you must click the Publish button at the end; otherwise, all the changes you made will lost.

Although there may be some differences in appearance, the options will almost be the same. This look is just a guide on how to start a blog and add information, so don’t stick with it.

Conclusion

Starting a blog, e-commerce online store, business website, or anything else can be made easier by installing WordPress.
WordPress offers a wide range of customization options to meet your needs. It gives you more control and flexibility over the features and appearance of a website.


This article has taught you not only how to install WordPress but also how to customize it and the WordPress theme.
We hope this article helps you create your website with WordPress.

title.rendered: WP-Content Uploads: How to Backup and Upload Files in WordPress

content.rendered:
WP-Content Uploads: This is very important in WordPress.

In this article, you will learn how to access the wp-content folder for downloading and uploading. We will use two methods to do all operations: hosting cPanel and FTP client.

The first method involves using hosting cPanel, and the second involves using an FTP client.

The WordPress CMS is made up of folders and files. WP-Content is an important folder that contains all the folders and files that are used in designing your website.

Importance of WP-Content Folder

Your WordPress theme folders, plugin folders, and media files are contained in WP-Content.

The theme is the structure and design of your website, and it uses media files like images, logos, and videos to make it appealing. The purpose of plugins is to add additional applications to your WordPress website.

Why Backup WP Content Folder.

Our website can be damaged by any attack on the WP-content folder. It is essential to back up this folder.

You can use this backup to restore your website in case of viruses, any hacking activity, or the accidental deletion of files.

It’s essential to understand that you shouldn’t make any modifications or deletions to WP content without technical knowledge of WordPress.

If you make a mistake with the WP-content folder, your website could be broken. 

Before any changes, it’s important to make a backup of the WP-content folder as a precaution.

Apart from that, whenever we have to change hosting, this folder also needs to be moved to another hosting.

So it is important to learn how to download the WP-Content folder on our local computer.

Where to Find wp-content/uploads in WordPress

To learn where to find wp-content/uploads, we will discuss the WordPress directory structure in brief.

It helps you to do download and upload operations on wp-content.

Directory Structure of WordPress 

You can see your hosting root directory is public_html, in public_html you will see the wp folder. This is the installation directory of the WordPress.

The wp directory further contains three directories wp-admin, wp-content, and wp-includes.

wp-admin:  Files and folders associated with the WordPress dashboard panel are found in the wp-admin folder.

wp-content: wp-content contains your website uploads, upgrades, themes, and plugins. This folder is responsible for your website design and structure which is depicted by theme, plugins, and pictures. 

wp-includes: wp-includes contains core WordPress files used to structure WordPress as a CMS. The purpose of this is to coordinate all core WordPress functions.

Now we will explain about wp-content sub-folders. 

Uploads: This folder contains media files, such as images, videos, etc. Its path is: public_html/wp-content/uploads

Themes: Themes folder contains all theme files, that design your WordPress website.

Plugins: This folder contains plugins that are used to add ready-made functionalities to WordPress. 

Upgrades: Upgrades folder contains files and data about upgrades. 

How to Access WP-Content Folder Using cPanel

The WP-content content can be accessed through hosting cPanel’s file manager or using an FTP client.

Here we will access the WP-Content folder through cPanel using File Manager. cPanle is a facility provided by your hosting to interact with your website’s backed files. 

In this article, you will learn how to manage the WP-content directory.

First log in to your hosting account.

Now you can see the cPanel dashboard.

In cPanel, find  the Files section and click File Manager

On the left sidebar find public_html, It is the root directory, Double-click your public_html folder

After clicking the public_html directory, You can see all containing files in the public_html folder. There is a wp folder, it is the installation directory of WordPress. 

Click the wp directory.

In the wp directory, you can see the wp-content folder, there are also other folders like the wp-admin and wp-includes folder.

But the wp-content folder contains all files and folders which are only specific to our website.

In the wp-content folder, you can see the themes folder, plugins folder, and other folders.

We can upload plugins and themes to this folder from our local computer’s hard drive.

Download the WP Content Folder For Backup

It is important to backup the wp-content folder on your local computer. All your website settings, design, themes, and plugins are contained in this folder.

The WP-content content can be backed up through hosting cPanel or using an FTP client.

How to Download WP Content Folder on Local Computer

You can backup it by downloading it on your local computer and saving it for future use.

Right-click the wp-content folder and click Compress.

You will see it will create a zip folder of wp-content named wp-content.zip

Now right-click it and click Download.

When you click Download, It will save copy of wp-content.zip file on your local computer.

How to Upload the WP-Content Folder Using cPanel

Cpanel or FPT are both options for uploading a file to the WP-content folder.

Here we will use cPanel

First, go to the wp main WordPress installation folder.

Click Upload in the top bar.

You will see a pop-up, as shown in the below picture.

Drop file wp-content.zip in it or click Select File

Now you can upload the wp-content.zip file by clicking the file.

You can see wp-content.zip file is uploaded in wp folder.

Now right-click the wp-content.zip file and click Extract.

This action will unzip your wp-content.zip file.

This will restore your website.

How to Access WP-Content folder Using FTP

Now we use an FTP client to download and upload WP-Content.

First download and install a FTP client.

1 Establish a connection to your WordPress using an FTP.

2 After establishing the connection, you can see the left side display your local file system. The right side displays your hosting file system.

3 Find or Navigate to the public_html root directory of your hosting file system. Search for WordPress installation. WordPress may be installed in the WP directory or directly to your website folder. 

4 Now click the wp folder to navigate to the WP-content directory. The path will be wp/wp-content. After clicking you can see we can see wp-incluce, wp-content folder, wp-admin folder.  

How To Download the WP-Content folder Using FTP Client

To download the WP-Content folder follow the steps below

5 Right-click the wp-content folder.

6 Click the Download option.

Where to Find wp-content/uploads in WordPress

If you don’t want to download the full wp-content folder you can download sub folders individually.

If you want to create a local copy of WordPress you can download only wp-content/upload. This folder contains a picture of your blog or website. And replace it with your local WordPress wp-content/upload folder.

7 Now double-click the wp-content folder. 

8 You can see the wp-content folder is opened and all sub folders are listed.

These folders are wp-content/plugins, wp-content/themes, and wp-content/upgrade, wp-content/upgrade-temp-backup, and wp-content/uploads.

Now you can download the wp-content/uploads folder.
9 Right-click the upload folder.
10 Click the download option in the menu.

Save the folder on your local computer.

How to use FTP to Upload WP-Content

Login FTP, Navigate to public_html/yourwebsite.com/wp-installation.

1 Find the wp-content folder on your local computer, and Right-click the folder.

2 A menu will appear, click Upload.

Secure WP-Content Directory

We can hide the WP-Content folder by modifying the .htaccess file.

Open cPanel

Navigate to the wp-content/uploads folder.

Create an index.php file you don’t need to add any code.

When anyone tries to open the upload folder it will display an empty screen.

Conclusion

The main files responsible for your website’s appearance reside in the WP-Content directory.
We can avoid any type of risk by saving it on a local computer.
In this article, you have learned how to backup and restore it.
We hope this article will help you to learn about your WordPress important directory that directly impacts your website design.

title.rendered: What is an External Link | 8 External Links Best Practices for SEO

content.rendered:
External links play an important role in the user experience and SEO.
In this article, we will discuss the meaning of external links. You will learn why external links are important and the best ways to use external links to get benefits.

What is an external link?

An External link is a hyperlink, also called an outbound link, that takes the user outside of your website to another website or resource.
It provides a good user experience.
Link to external resources also supports Google search engine to understand what is about your content and niche.

Example of an external link:


Here is an article about <a href="/posts/what-is-an-external/" >external links </a>, which you can read.

The code for an external link and its appearance on the webpage can be seen in the picture below.

Internal Links, External Links, and Backlinks

Internal links connect pages within your website. The user is taken to another page within the website after clicking an internal link. The purpose of this is to navigate between website pages.

An external link redirects the visitor to a different domain. These links could be either resources for references or affiliate links.

Back links are the links that direct people to your website from a different website.

What is the purpose of using external links?

Using an external link is a good idea for several reasons.

External Links to Enhance Credibility.

External links provide references to points in your writing. When readers find a credible link to another website, they automatically develop a picture in their minds about your content’s credibility. It makes sense in their minds that you have done research before creating content.

Target links make the reader understand that the point discussed by you is enough support from another resource. It is human psychology.
He doesn’t need to visit the link, but it may give a credible impression without visiting the link.
So visitors spend more time because they feel satisfied with your website.

Reference for Readers

It’s not always feasible to explain all the terms in your article, but they are crucial for understanding the concept.
Providing a link to that information would be helpful to the reader. Your article will be easy for them to read and they will stay longer on your website because it will increase their satisfaction. The engagement of readers will be improved and they will return to your website.

Positive Impact of External Links on SEO.

Google’s objective is to display the most relevant results for every query. External links are regarded as good by Google.

Linking to a high-quality page will result in Google considering your page. By linking to a high-quality page that supports your point and adds further value to your page, Google gives you some preferences because you are providing value.

The anchor text of the external link aids Google in identifying your website’s content. The Google search algorithm is complex and takes into account all these factors.

Your content can be better understood by both Google and users if you link to websites with deep information.
When Google sends visitors to your website, your content provides a comprehensive chain of knowledge. Your website is considered a starting point in the chain.

External Linking Best Practices

While external links are essential for SEO, they also lead your reader to another website. Hence, it’s essential to follow the external linking best practices.
Without knowledge, using them will result in a decrease in your ranking rather than a rise.

Before using external links, it’s important to consider some points. Our discussion will focus on each of them individually, and you will gain a deeper understanding of how to utilize them to achieve more benefits.

Ensure That the Links are Relevant

SEO is only helped by adding external links that are relevant to your content and add value to it.
Include links that support your point or add more details to your content.
Your point may be backed up by facts, statistics, or research, or it could be a link leading to a video that provides clarification.
Include an external link that is related to your niche. You have the option to link to services that are beneficial for users.

Link to Trustworthy Websites.

It’s important to choose an authoritative and professional website for your external link. Linking to websites that are clickbait content is not recommended, as it will negatively impact user experience.
It has a negative effect on SEO and lowers your search engine rank.
To add links to websites that you don’t trust, you must add the nofollow attribute.

The Importance of Using Anchor Text Correctly.

Correct use of anchor text is crucial for SEO and the user’s perspective.
To understand, let’s consider an example:

We want to share a link to an article about how to start a blog.

Bad practice: to know how to start a blog, click here.

Good practice: to know how to start a blog, make full line anchor text — “How to Start a Blog.”
You can see the anchor text in the sentences “Here” and “How to start a blog”
The second approach helps to understand that this link is to “How to Start a Blog,” which makes sense. So the Google search engine will better understand related content for anchor text.
So use meaningful keywords in the text; otherwise, the Google search engine may not consider it.
It is not good to shoehorn text into sentences because it may look like spam.

Number of External links per Page.

There is not a definite answer. Include as many links as is necessary for your content. Adding more links solely for SEO purposes is not a good idea, as it could have a negative impact on your SEO.

Your primary aim should be to enhance the user experience by providing references. If necessary, you have the option to add several links.

Add links naturally; don’t add them if they’re not needed or just sprinkle them throughout the page without any need.
This will annoy readers, and they will leave your page.

Open the External Links in a New Tab.

It’s best to open the external link in a new tab. By doing this, you can access the target website without closing your page.
Readers can easily return to your page. It will improve your engagement time, and you will not lose your reader.

Add the target=”_blank” attribute to open up a new browser tab.
This will open the website in a new tab. example

Avoid Linking to Competitors’ Websites.

Competitor website does not mean that someone is directly competing with you. If a website has the same keyword as your article, it is considered a competitor. It means that you are adding a link to a website that has already published the same content.
If you add an external link to such a website, you are directing your reader to a website with old content but a higher ranking in Google.

Adding links to credible sources is something we always do. Your readers won’t come to your website because you’re directing them to a more credible source with similar content.
Add an external link to Source that is not identical to your content, but only explains your specific point.

Perform Regular Link Audits.

Occasionally, the pages you link to are removed or their URLs are modified. Such links are called broken links. Users are directed to a 404 page when they click on these links.

The user’s time is wasted and the user experience is negatively impacted. Your content is perceived as outdated by them. External broken links have a negative impact on your credibility.
Broken links are detected by the Google search engine during your website’s crawl and are considered a poor user experience, which negatively impacts your website’s SEO.

So it is good practice to regularly audit your external links and remove or correct any broken links.

Never Add a Bad External Link.

Link exchange schemes are not good for SEO, so it’s best to avoid them. Such links are easily noticed because they are irrelevant.

Avoid selling or purchasing links for SEO, link exchanges for SEO, links to illegal websites and programs, or backlinks from low-quality content or directories.
Google’s algorithms are smart enough to detect these scams. If you engage in such activity, Google penalizes your website and lowers your ranking, resulting in the loss of all your hard work.

Conclusion

The user experience is greatly impacted by the quality of external links. The inclusion of references to explain the points mentioned in your content is a valuable aspect of good content.
Include an external link in your content to ensure the authenticity of your content in the reader’s mind. when the reader finds an appropriate reference, it enhances user experience.

title.rendered: How to Create a Landing Page in WordPress | 3 Methods

content.rendered:
This article covers how to create a Landing Page in WordPress.

A landing page is created to convert the visitor into a potential customer. The main purpose of the landing page is to encourage visitors to click the button, the call to action.

So after clicking the link, visitors are directly sent to the landing page from email, search engines, Facebook, YouTube, Twitter, Instagram, websites, or any ads running on these networks.
The landing page may sell services, digital products, courses, subscriptions, etc.

How to Create a Landing Page in WordPress With a Plugin

A landing page can be easily created in WordPress using a plugin. Two methods can be used to create a landing page. In the first method, you can use a ready-made template. It is an easy method as you just edit the template.

The second method allows to create landing page, by joining ready-made sections or using custom sections. This method is more customizable.
Now let’s create a landing page in WordPress using the plugin step by step.

Install the Landing Page Plugin

In the search box search for the Landing Page. You will see several Landing page plugins.

Will will install the SeedProd plugin.

To install click “Install Now” After installation, click “Activate” to activate the plugin

After activation, you will see the Setup wizard. We will skip it and install it from the dashboard. To skip click “Exit Setup”.

Create Landing Page in WordPress Using Ready made Template.

Go to the left sidebar in the WordPress dashboard, Find and Click SeedProd.

Now you will see the Page to start page creation. Now click Create New Landing Page at the bottom.

On the next page, you can select your page category as  Coming Soon, Maintenance, 404 Page, Sales, Webinar, Lead Squeeze, Thank You, and Login.

This will help narrow down the selection numbers of templates and you will find your category template easily.

I will select Sales as the category.

Now click the template you want to use to create a Landing page.

Now enter the name of your Landing page and click Save and Start Editing Page.

Now you can see a template. You can change text and pictures according to your needs. 

To make any change click the area and you will see the options to delete, copy, etc.

To change text click the text and write or paste your own text in the title and paragraph.

You can easily change pictures with your images. 

To replace the picture, click the picture. This will show an image thumbnail left sidebar. When you hover the mouse over the picture thumbnail, it will show two icons. Click the orange icon to upload your picture to replace the old image.

We also changed the button title from Let’s Cook to Let’s Start by clicking and adding new text.

You can see in the next picture we have changed the picture, button title, and paragraph text successfully. 

Now we have to change the icon. The old icon is DINS click it near the top bar or you can find it in the left sidebar. Replace it as you changed other pictures.

You can see, that we have customized the landing page. We used our logo it10x, right side image, and text.

You can make changes in all sections of the page similarly. It is very easy.

You can also make changes in templates from the template tab at the top of the left sidebar.  

You can also do advance setting. As shown in the next picture.

In the page setting option, you can change settings.

Create a Landing page in WordPress Using custom sections

This is second method in which we join section template to create a landing page in WordPress. We can add as many sections according to our needs.

To start go to the WordPress left side bar and click SeedProd.

After click you will see first box. when you hover mouse over it, it will show check mark. Click this mark.

You will see a prompt box, Fill your page name.

Now click Save and Start Editing the Page

In top bar select Design and Section in sub menu.

You can see a list of sections in the left sidebar. You can choose one by one to add to your landing page according to your page needs. You can add or left any section. This picture shows collection of Hero sections.

In next picture you can see Call to Action sections collection.

So you can see you can use ready made section to create landing page.

Full Customize Landing Page

In this method you can create landing page in WordPress using block in each section. So you can customize every section fully. And these section together make your landing page.

To create landing page select Design in to menu bar and Blocks in sub menu.

Now you can add individual block to the section and create section in various ways.

You can use as many section by adding blocks.

This method is little time consuming but you can create fully custom landing page

Publish Your Landing Page in WordPress

After Creating the landing page and saving it, we need to publish it to make it live.

For that, Select the Design tab in the page editing dashboard. You can see a Save button on the top right side. Click the drop-down menu next to it.  

You will see the Publish button, Click this button.

In the Page Setting tab, you can edit the page title, page URL.

You can also add your affiliate link to earn a commission.. 

By enabling isolation mode you can prevent conflict of hooks like wp_head and wp_footer. However, after enabling the SEO and analytics plugin would not run on the page.

Connecting With Third-Party Tools


Third-party tools help to increase customer acquisition and improve revenue.
In SeedProd, we have the facility to integrate third-party tools.
Here are some examples of third-party tools you can incorporate into your landing page.

ActiveCampaign

It is a sales automation tool and CRM platform designed for small businesses. It helps manage sales teams, leads, data, and customer engagement.
You can use ActiveCampaign to integrate marketing automation, email marketing, sales automation, and

Zapier

Zapier is a tool for small to mid-sized businesses that helps to integrate data between web apps. Zapier helps with process automation.

Google Analytics

Google Analytics is a free tool by Google to collect website traffic data. It shows the performance of your landing page and collects visitor insights.
You can find the source of traffic and create your marketing strategy accordingly. Ultimately, improve your reputation and decrease your cost.

Mailchimp

Mailchimp is an email marketing platform. You can send emails to your clients and can communicate with them. It helps to keep updated with clients about your new services and acquire more clients and customers.
It also provides data analysis, contact management, campaign design, and an auto responder feature.

title.rendered: What is Google Trends? 3 Ways How Bloggers | Marketers | Business Can Leverage

content.rendered:
if you are a content writer, marketer, or SEO expert then Google Trends can help you.

Are you in search of a new and lucrative blogging niche or need something new to write about?

Or want to know the correct time for marketing.

Google Trends is the ideal tool to discover trendy ideas.

In this article, you will learn how to use Google Trends to research better-demanded topics to create content about.
We’ll explain different ways to leverage Google trends.

What is Google Trends?

Google Trends is a service that Google provides to find new trends in searches. It reveals the current trends and topics that are popular and frequently searched for.

Google Trends provides data on the current trends and seasonal variation.

Information is categorized by time span, country, or even the region of the country.


This is a useful tool to gain an understanding of what is happening globally and utilize it for our purposes. It benefits business, whether it’s blogging, marketing, or anything else, may be affected by trends.

You will learn how to utilize both for the benefit of our business.

Find Specific Data of Seasonal Variations

To obtain seasonal variations in search data, Google Trend is a very useful tool. It shows when a particular thing is more significant for people.

Using search data from Google Trends is advantageous for seasonal businesses.
Identify a season when search terms that are relevant to your business are on the rise and then develop your strategy. So based on demand, it will determine when and what to advertise.
Content creation, services, or products may be the focus of this demand to get benefits.

How to use Google Trends to discover variations in trends.

In order to discover seasonal trends, we can use a keyword that is connected to our business or service and then explore more information.

Let’s explain the procedure now.
You can observe the initial Google Trend Dashboard.


First, select “Explore” in the top bar.
Then enter a search term or keyword.

Now you can change other parameters like country, time range, category, and type.
Country: if we want to find search data across the world, then we can select “Worldwide”; otherwise, select a country to find search data in a specific country.
Time Range: This is used to select a period for search data.
category: Nowadays, time is a term that can be used in multiple areas from different perspectives. In that case, we can select categories according to our area of search.

type of search, for example, which type is related to your search (about which you like to get data) like a website, image, or YouTube

To understand all, take a case study of tourism. Now let us suppose you are providing services about tourism, for example, providing guides and rides in the USA, running a tourism blog, or being a marketer about tourism.
Now that all these have different scenarios,
If you are a provider of services or sell products about tourism, you will enter a keyword for tourism in the search bar.

Now you want to know at which time of year you should search for information about tourism so that you can make your selling strategy more effective.
As you need USA data, select “USA” and “Past 12 months” as time rages. and category as Autos & Vehicles.

The search trend is high from June 11th to July 9th, and low from October 16th to February 18th, so this will help you plan your marketing strategy.

You have options to search worldwide or by country, sub region, metro area, or city, as in the next picture.

Finding the Currently Trending topic.

Using Google Trends, you can find what are currently hot topics. The data is derived from a Google search.
It is possible to pick a data type that is relevant to our business, such as celebrity, business, content, or art.
Finding a popular topic to write about or choosing a trending marketing field can be beneficial.

Trends can be found in both by time span and area wise for example worldwide, country, sub region, metro area, or city.

How to use Google Trends to find current trends

To find out what is currently trending, simply go to ‘Trending Now’.
Choose a country if you require information about a particular country.
Now you can find the top queries sorted by volume. You can choose ‘Daily search trends’ for that purpose. The queries will be listed according to their volume, with high volume at the top and low volume at the bottom.
This method help you to quickly find a topic to write about.

To find search trends click “Trending Now”.

You can see there are two options, “Daily search trends” and “Real time search trends”.

Select “Daily search trends”.

Next choose Country.

If you want to do search for specific category choose category. Otherwise it show most trending topic in all categories.


Another option is to find trends in real time. By using that, you can find trends in a particular topic. We have the option to either find all trending topics by default or select a specific category.
This will show 24-hour data on that keyword in the form of a graph showing a decrease and increase in trend.

To find real time data click “Realtime search trends”

You can search country wise real time data.

Brand Search data Comparison.

We can also compare trends for two search terms. This enables us to conduct a comparative analysis. The topic could be about products, services, and competition between competitors.

This will assist in understanding the future outlook and adopting a strategy.

You can compare two or more than two brand.

Here we will take example of three car companies, by comparing their search data.

You can take your keywords to compare their search data.

To star fill your keyword in first box. Than click “+ Add comparison” button to enter next keyword.

Now you can see three graph line yellow, blue and read, representing three cars search trends.

In the next picture region vise data. You can select any submersion.

In the next section you can see data specific to Mercedes-Benz.

In the next section you can see data specific to Bentley.

In the next section you can see data specific to Audi A3.

How Individuals or Businesses Can Benefit From Google Trends?

Google Trend is a useful and free service offered by Google. It can be utilized in various fields.

Finding Your Beneficial Niche

Google Tread provides us with data that reveals what’s trending, what’s seasonal, what’s on the rise, and what’s on the decline. Learning about all of these parameters is necessary. Selecting a niche can be made easier by knowing the prospects and stability of a niche.
Field-related data enables us to estimate the pros and cons of a potential niche.

Planning advertising campaigns and minimizing costs.

By analyzing search data, it is possible to understand the market demand based on popularity. Scheduling our campaigns according to trends can save us money.
So cost planning can be achieved in seasonal campaigns to avoid unnecessary expenses.
We can also find countries or areas where topics are polar based on search data.
By avoiding advertisements in downfall seasons and learning about low-trending areas, we can avoid money wastage.

Content Creation, Marketing and SEO

By using Google Trends, we can determine user attitudes at different times of the year. Google Trends also lets us know what peoples are searching. This will help us to develop our SEO strategy.

It is also very helpful for content creators to know what people are searching for. By knowing about current trends, content creators can create for the topic.

Local SEO Strategy

Google Trends provides data at the city level. By utilizing this data, we can find search terms that are popular in our area.
This will aid in discovering customer preferences in the local area. We can develop a marketing strategy that is tailored to local customers.
So Google Trends is an excellent tool for local SEO.

Emerging vs. old trends.

Apart from seasonal variation it also shows trends that are on the rise and what is on the decline. This is very helpful in business to create a strategy.

Compare the Popularity of Brands.

The comparing option of Google Trends allows you to compare brands’ popularity by analyzing search data.
Knowing your competitor’s popularity and where your brand stands in the competition can be beneficial to develop a strategy.
It is more important to know your competitor’s data to realize your position in the market

Popular Topic on other Platforms like YouTube.

It not only gives search data about the website but also shows us what people are searching on YouTube and in images.

This also helps YouTube content create to know the tastes of viewers.

Finding Hot Topic.

Google Trends reveals the importance of some events. It gives information about hot topic which are very helpful to know about what is top in the news.
It also tells about personalities, and events that people are searching for.

Conclusion

Trends and seasonal variations in trends can be found using Google Trends, which is a very useful tool. Content creators, writers, marketers, and SEO experts can efficiently utilize it.
We hope that you gain knowledge about the capabilities of Google Trends and how to use them for your business.

title.rendered: Personal Blog Meaning | How Does a Microblog Differ From a Personal Blog

content.rendered:
Blogging has become a profitable profession in recent times. Earning money and sharing ideas with others is what personal blogging is all about.
The focus of this article is to learn:
what is a personal blog?
What are the basic things we should consider before starting a personal blog?

By developing a clear concept of personal blogging in your mind, you can implement everything smoothly and effectively.

What is Personal Blog Meaning?

A personal blog is a blog that is run and managed by an individual instead of an organization. 

Content-wise, a personal blog concentrates on topics that belong to the individual’s life, such as matters that are concerning to individual or that they are passionate about.

A personal blog is where an individual expresses their opinions on a topic. An online platform allows writers to share their ideas, opinions, and interests about daily life and experiences.

Personal blogs cover a wide range of subjects, from health to technology.

The writing of a personal blog is done in the first person’s perspective and provides information to the second person in an informal manner.

What is Micro Blogging and How Does a Microblog Differ From a Personal Blog

Micro is used to describe posts that are short in length. Microblogging is about delivering concise and limited-character content that can be readily consumed.

Microblogs, also known as social media or blogging, are popular for quick response and ease of use.

Microblogging promotes quick and immediate sharing with real-time information flow. Users can share their thoughts, news, or updates with a large audience through microblogging. 

Examples of microblogging platforms include Twitter, which requires tweets to be limited to 280 characters. Tumblr is another good example of microblogging, and Facebook and Instagram also include features for microblogging.

How Does a Microblog Differ From a Personal Blog

Character Limit

A typical rule for microblogs is to limit the number of characters in a single post. The restriction encourages users to convey information concisely.

Real-Time Updates

Real-time updates drive microblogs forward. In Microblogging instant information sharing is possible for users, which contributes to a quick and dynamic online environment.

Hashtags and Trends

Microblogging greatly benefits from the presence of hashtags. Their role is to categorize content and contribute to creating trends.

High Users Engagement

Quick interactions, such as likes, shares, and comments, are encouraged by microblogs. In real-time, users can interact with content, which improves communication and feedback.

Some More Characteristics of Microblogs

The following characteristics are also found in personal blogs.

Use of Multimedia

Images, GIFs, and short videos can often be included in microblog posts, providing visual appeal and variety to the content. In a personal blog, multimedia is also important.

Global Reach of Content

Microblogging platforms permit users to connect with a worldwide audience. The discovery of content beyond the user’s immediate followers is improved by the use of hashtags.

Purpose of Microblogs

There are various reasons for Microblogging such as sharing discussing current events,  personal updates, conversations on specific topics, brand awareness, and promoting products or services. Microblogging’s simplicity makes it accessible to a wide range of users.

Answers to the question, of why people write personal blogs have many answers.

Personal Blog vs Blog?

One thing that distinguishes personal blog from others is that they are about life experience and passion. The personalities of writers (creators) have an impact on personal blogs.

A personal blog differs from a magazine article, it does not focus only on the subject but also provides a glimpse into the writer’s life.
In a personal blog, if an article is about a recipe, it will have a different style and not focus solely on the recipe. The writer’s life incident will be covered, including how he discovered the recipe when he used the recipe, how he had fun with friends while making food, etc.

Why write a personal blog?

In fact, personal blogging was the starting point of blogging. When blogging started, it was mostly personal.
Personal blogs are used to build an online community for like-minded people, to market personal businesses, earn money, and gain followers.
It may be an online diary to update friends and family about your activities in life or may be a means of sharing your interests with others.

The Significance of a Personal Blog

A personal blog is a digital platform for connecting with others through technology.
By talking from an individual’s perspective, we can share experience and promote business in the best way possible.
This method is more effective than the old methods that are costly and require a lot of money for advertisement.

More and more individuals are switching to online platforms. So we can find more Audiences on the online platform.
In the past, it was not possible to believe that the Internet would become a marketing tool, but it has happened.

In a personal blog, you have the opportunity to express your thoughts, share interests, and earn money by sharing knowledge and personal experiences.
Personal blogs are important; many blogs on the internet started as personal blogs and have become large businesses.

What will make your personal blog stand out?

Write for readers and offer value in your content. To connect with your reader, it’s important to be honest in your writing.
Ensure that your content is original and of high quality. Be careful not to repeat the same thing. Each paragraph contains a unique piece of information.
By maintaining authenticity in the reader’s mind, they will return to your blog to find information and advice.

How to Start a Personal blog and Putting it Online

Blogging has undergone a complete change. If you start a blog, as started at an earlier time, no one reads it, and search engines almost ignore it.

Starting a blog requires a few thing to be bear in mind. We will explain all these, one by one.

Register Domain Name and Hosting

The initial step is to purchase a hosting and register a domain name.

Your blog’s name is also referred to as a domain name. Searching for your blog on the Internet is done using a domain name.

Hosting is a facility that stores all files that contain written content in digital format and the structure of your blog.

So domain is used to point the hosting. When someone enters your website domain name (URL), it fetches all data from the server and displays it on the user’s browser (client).

Hosting services are provided by hosting providers, who also offer domain names.

Installing and Setting up the Blog CMS

The next step is to install a content management system (CMS).
You only need to set up the software once, and then you can add your content with a few clicks. It generates posts automatically.
The structure is created according to your theme choice. You have the option to customize that theme to fit your preferences.
WordPress is the most popular CMS. You can easily learn all about WordPress at it10x.com.

The appearance of a blog is significant for the end user, so choose a theme that is attractive and aligns with your niche.

Adding more Functionalities to WordPress

After installing and setting up WordPress you can add more functionalities to WordPress. To add the additional functions, you just need to install plugins. You do not need any technical knowledge.

You can use these Plugins, to back up your blog, add snippets to WordPress, find WordPress site statistics to promote your blog, and improve WordPress site speed.

Even, to promote your blog, you can install an SEO plugin.
There are also security plugins to secure your blog.

You can do all these and many more without knowing coding with the help of plugins.

Start Writing on Your Blog

It’s crucial to begin writing without worrying about perfection. Soon enough, you will come to the realization that you will acquire perfection with time. Soon, you will have the flow and experience to write more effectively. Your thoughts will begin to form automatically.

Learning something requires you to do it yourself.

Point to Remember for Personal Bloggers.

Choose a suitable niche.

A niche is a subject that you will write about in your blog.

Choosing a niche that is aligned with your passion is crucial.
Pick a topic that you enjoy speaking and writing about without becoming tired.

Here is a small list of niches.

  • Money
  • Lifestyle
  • Travel
  • Food
  • Health
  • Beauty
  • Fitness
  • Fashion
  • Technology, etc

More Specific niches example.

  • Credit Card
  • Weight loss for retirees
  • Electric Cars
  • Career advise for veterans

Currently, personal blogs are categorized into micro and macro niches. You should understand difference between macro and micro niche. Less specific niche can help you broaden your article range.

Choosing a niche carefully will enable you to write passionately and pursue your work with pleasure.

Use social media to promote your blog at the right time.

Once you have enough content, begin promoting your blog.
It’s important to first focus on content creation. After enough content, you start promoting it.

If you begin a promotion without sufficient content, you won’t be able to attract long-term readers.
Readers will leave the site soon and won’t come back because of the lack of content. The time you spend on promotion will be wasted.
Creating content is the first step, followed by promotion.

Enhance the Appearance of Your Content

Writing and decorating content is necessary to attract readers’ interest.
The content on your blog is not sufficient to engage users; you need to include images, numbers, and info-graphics to make it attractive,.
This will keep your readers entertained and prevent them from becoming bored.
Search engine optimization (SEO) will greatly benefit from this.

Learn from others’ work.

Observe other blogs that are related to your niche. Don’t copy them, but learn what they done and the points they are focusing on.
It will greatly assist you in your progress, and push you forward.

How do make money from a personal blog?

Your blog can be a source of income in numerous ways.

Ads can be published on your blog; for instance, you can use ad networks like Google AdSense, Adsterra, or Mediavine.

Selling your own products on your blog, such as e-books and courses, is an option. 

If you don’t have your own products, you can sell others’ products and receive a commission from them. It is called the affiliate market. You can earn commissions by promoting other products and services. 

Becoming a sponsor, writing about a product on your blog, and earning money are other options.

Educating others can help you establish your expertise in a specific field, promote your business, and increase your earning potential.

By opening doors to learn about your interests and passions and offering consulting services to your readers, you can earn money.

Popular Personal Blog Examples

Let’s see 6 popular personal blogs it will help you to choose your niche and make some decisions. You can learn a lot from these blogs.

1 James Clear

James Clear runs this blog. He is an entrepreneur, a photographer, and a life coach. In his articles, he gives tips about good habits, time management, decision-making, etc. He writes about life improvement.

2 Mr. Money Mustache

title.rendered: How to add Related Posts to the WordPress Post: 3 Easy way.

content.rendered:
Related posts are a very helpful method to improve SEO. It will increase readers time on your website if they find related content on the website. It also decreases the bounce rate.
As our website grows, there are more articles on it, which take more of the reader’s time to find related topics on the website. So sometimes they leave the site.
Apart from that, related posts are considered good by search engines for SEO.
Sometimes your older posts are very deep if the number of posts is high; by providing a link to a related post, we can improve their page views. This will help engage the readers on the website and increase page SEO.

In this article, we will show you two methods to display a related post on your website.
Every method has pros and cons, you can choose. according to your preferences.

Adding Related Posts manually to Website

In this method, adding related posts to your blog post is a simple and easy process.
If you are able to publish a post, you have enough knowledge to add posts to a related post list.
You don’t require any extra technical knowledge.
The flexibility of this method makes it possible to customize your related post list. You have the option to add any post you want, but it’s not possible using any other method.
It doesn’t impact website speed because we add related posts without using plugins, and save our WordPress from the extra load
As a drawback, it takes a bit more time to create a related post list.

Steps:

Go to the bottom of the post. Write “Related Posts” or any title like “Related Tutorials” in the H3 tag.

Now Click the “+” sign to add more text, then click “List” as shown in the image below.

Now write the title of the post you want to add in the related post list. Or you can copy the title of post the post and paste it. see the image below.

Now select the title and click the link icon, as shown in the image

It will open a box to enter the URL of the post.

Open the post in browser and copy URL.

Now paste this link in the link box and click “Link” as shown in the image.

You can see, the first post title has been added to the related post list.

You can repeat the same process to add more posts. You can add as many posts, as you like But it is good to add 4 – 5 post links.

Now you can see the final view of related posts, on the bottom of the post page, as shown in the image below.

Adding Related Posts Using Plugins.

List Category Posts Plugin.

The list category posts plugin is a simple and easy-to-use plugin for generating Related Posts links.

Plugin Stats:

  • Downloads: 100,000+ Active Installations
  • Rating: 4.5/5
  • Price: free

This plugin generates a list of posts from the current post’s category. It helps readers to read more post that matches the current post.
It is a free plugin.

Steps:

To Install List Category Post plugins, go to the WordPress dashboard and find “Plugins” in the left sidebar.

Click “Add New”.

You will see plugins list. Now search for “Related Post” as a keyword.

Now find List Category Posts plugin and Click “Install”, and after installation click “Activate”.

To change setting search for “List Category Posts” in Settings, and click it.

Now it will open List Category Posts dashboard.

You can change number of posts, Pagination , Order by date, Post title, Id, Random, Author name etc.

Also you can choose order Descending or Ascending.

New picture show how Related Post look on the Post page after setting.

You can select “Pagination” true like the following picture.

It will show show “PREVIOUS” and “NEXT” link on the post page like following picture.

YARPP – Plugin for Related Posts.

Plugin Stats:

  • Downloads: 100,000+ Active Installations
  • Rating: 5/5
  • Price: free

Yet Another Related Posts Plugin (YARPP) provides a customizable list of related posts.
It generates a related post list using a robust algorithm according to post categories, titles, tags, and custom taxonomies.

YARPP uses inbuilt caching facilities, custom templates, RSS and REST API support,
It has Multisite WordPress, bbPress, and WooCommerce integration capabilities.

By default, it shows related posts under the post content, but by using a shortcode we can place related posts anywhere within the posting page.

Installation and Setup.

Click “Add New”.

Now search for “Related Post”.

Now find List YARPP “Install Now”, and after installation click “Activate”.

To change setting options click “YARPP” in Settings menu link in left side bar.

Now you can make YARPP basic settings.

Next screen use to change algorithm for posts for related posts links.

Next option is used to change display option.

For place of related post list and design for example List, Thumbnails, or Custom.

You can also view of list post for different device screens.

Next is the related posts view, according to our chosen options.

Custom Related Posts Plugins.

Plugin Stats:

  • Downloads: 100,000+
  • Rating: 4.5/5
  • Price: free

The Custom Related Post plugin allows you to manually add related posts to posts or pages. The process of adding related posts is flexible, and you have the option to control related links and choose them yourself. You can customize related posts according to your preferences.

Step to install plugin.

To Install Custom Related Posts plugin, go to the WordPress dashboard and hover over “Plugins” in the left sidebar.

And Click “Add New”

Now search for “Related Post”.

Now find List Custom Related Posts plugin.

Click “Install Now”, and after installation click “Activate”.

Now we need to change setting options according to our choice.

Hover over “Setting” in left side bar, and click “Custom Related Posts”.

Next is Documentation.

Change General settings.

Next is template and you can also add advance CSS.

Conclusion

It is better to show related posts at the end of a blog post because it increases the user experience and allows them to find related content easily on your blog. It help to decrease the bounce rate and ultimately improve SEO.
If you find it difficult to use a plugin, you can use the manual method explained in this article.
We hope this article will help you a lot to add related posts to your WordPress post.

title.rendered: 3 Way: How to Take WordPress Backup and Restore.

content.rendered:
WordPress backup is very important to run a WordPress website smoothly. It is a preventive measure to save your website after any crashes due to any reason.

It is important to store backups on a remote location other than your website server.

So a WordPress backup is very important to save yourself from any losses, ruin your effort, and save a lot of time.

Manual Method Using Cpanel for WordPress Backup

First log in to hosting Cpanel.

After logging in, you will see cPanel dashboard.

Backup Database Using phpMyAdmin.

Now find the Database toward the bottom of Cpanel.

In the database section, Click “phpMyAdmin”

Now you can see a list of databases in the left sidebar.
Click the database you want to back up.

After selecting the database you can see a list of all tables of the database.

Select the box “Check all”.
This will select all tables for backup. If you want to download individual tables, you can select one,
but for full backup, download all tables.

After selecting all tables, now click “Export” in the top bar of phpMyAdimin.
Now you will see the next screen.

Select your options for backup.
Leave select quick, Select Format as SQL
Now click “Export”

Backup Website Files Manually using cPanel.

Login to cPanel. Now Click Files Manager.

Now you can see the file manager opened, open public_html, and click it.

After clicking public_ftp now find the directory which you want to backup. Let’s you want to backup “wp” WordPress directory.

Now right-click “wp” directory and click “Compress”.

Now in next picture you can see popup, select destination directory.


Now click “Compress Files”.

Now click “Download” to download the zip file.


Save your downloaded zip file on your computer.

Using cPanel integrated function for WordPress Backup

We have two option for cPanel backup, Full backup and Partial Backup.

First we will learn about full backup.

WordPress Backup: Full Backup Method.

Full Backup generates a compressed copy of your entire cPanel account and website.
It includes all databases, files, subdomains, email accounts, email lists, etc.
You can not restore your website using the cPanel interface.
Your hosting provider is capable of restoring the website using this zipped backup. You need to upload the full zipped backup file into your website’s home directory and ask the hosting provider to restore the website.

A full backup is beneficial when you need to transfer a website from the current host to another host.

To take the website’s full backup, please follow these steps.

Steps:

Go to the cPanel and find Files section

Click “Backup” in the file section.

Now you will see the next screen. At the top section under Full Backup
Click the “Download a Full Account Backup” Button

In the next section, Select the Backup destination (Home Directory) and Email address.
Backup Destination is used to save the database after the completion of the backup and the email address is used to receive a message after completion of database backup.

Now click “Generate Backup”
After clicking Generate Backup you will see Backup Progress Message.

After completion, if you select the backup destination as Home Directory, you can find your Full backup zip file in your home directory.

You can download it and save it for future use to transfer the website or restore the website if something happens badly.

WordPress Backup: Partial Backup Method.

In a partial backup, we can download the website’s different components individually. Using cPanel, you can restore these individual backups yourself. 

You have the option to download your website’s Howe Directory, Database, Email accounts, Email Forwarders, and Email Filters.

For partial WordPress Backup follow the step ahead.

It is similar to full backup follow all the steps as in full WordPress backup, after reaching the backup page, Under the Full backup section you can find the Partial Backup section.

Here you can see the download Home Directory button. To download the Home Directory click the “Home Directory” button.

Under that, a Databases list is shown, and you can select a database and download it.

Next under the “Database” you can see Download Email Forwarder.
You can select the email and download it.

Restore WordPress Backup

In partial backup, you can restore the home directory, databases, email forwarders, and email filters.
You can see on the right side of the download button, there are upload buttons.
You can click these buttons to upload and restore the home directory, databases, email forwarders, and email filters.
Click the upload button, select the WordPress backup file from your local drive, and restore the backup.
Don’t be confused if the cPanel interface in your case is different. Although there may be little differences according to the cPanel version or hosting, but steps will be similar

Use a WordPress Backup Plugin

WordPress Backup plugin makes it easy for you to back up your WordPress website.

Using the WordPress Backup plugin doesn’t require a lot of technical knowledge.

There are many WordPress backup plugins that we can use. We explain how to use the free version of UpdraftPlus.

To install UpdraftPlus and take a backup of WordPress, follow the steps below.

Installing WordPress Backup Plugin Updraft

First login to the WordPress dashboard.

Now find plugin in left sidebar of WordPress dashboard and click “Add New”

Now find the plugin in the left sidebar of the WordPress dashboard and click “Add New”

Now search for “updraft” and then click “Install Now”

After installation “Install Now” button will convert to “Activate” Click it.

Taking BackUp Using Updraft Plugin.

It easy very easy to take backup and restore using Updraft Plugin.

Taking First time Backup

After completion of the backup you will see this screen for the wizard to take a first-time backup it is very easy. just follow the steps.

To start Wizard click “Press here to start!”.
You will see the next screen.

Click “Backup Now”.
Select your Backup options. Check the First check box if you want to include the database and select the second checkbox if also want to include files. You can select both boxes to backup both database and files.

Now click “Backup Now”. You will see progress bar.

After completion, you will see the following screen.

Restoring Backup Using WordPress Backup Plugin Updraft.

Now click Restore.

Select your options for backup.

Schedule Backup Using WordPress Backup Plugin Updraft.

We can schedule Database backup in Setting options of the updraft plugin:

Conclusion.


In this article, we have mentioned three ways to back up.
Using the cPanel partial backup method, you can download individual components of your website and save them to your local drive.

Similarly using phpMyAdmin, you can download your website database.

Using a WordPress plugin is a simple way to backup and restore.
We hope this article will help you to secure your WordPress Website.

  • How to Start a Blog | 9 Steps to Create a Blog to Make You Money
  • What is SEO Strategy | SEO Content Strategy with 6 Point to get More Traffic.

title.rendered: All in one SEO Tutorial: How to Install and Configure, Know Content Writing Parameters.

content.rendered:
WordPress SEO optimization is a crucial task after starting a blog. To earn revenue, we need traffic, which is the primary purpose of the blog.
To boost traffic, we must put in some effort. It is challenging for beginners without technical knowledge.
A WordPress SEO plugin is the answer to this issue. If you have a WordPress website or blog, you can solve this issue by using a WordPress SEO plugin.
By completing small steps with the SEO plugin, you can improve your WordPress SEO without any technical knowledge.
All in one SEO is a plugin that is very useful for WordPress SEO. All in one SEO plugin guides us through all processes in a step-by-step manner. We don’t require a lot of technical knowledge for that.
A feature in All in one SEO plugin is available to enhance content writing. It helps for better content writing by pinpointing errors in content.

Importance of WordPress SEO Plugin.

Website SEO requires technical knowledge. In WordPress, there are SEO plugins that can assist you.


The WordPress SEO Plugin is extremely useful in completing tasks to improve WordPress SEO. It automates certain SEO tasks and provides guidance on how to take the right steps.

With the help of an SEO plugin, you can complete all tasks without hiring a technical SEO expert. All this saves a considerable amount of time.

How to Install WordPress All in one SEO Plugin

To Install SEO plugins, visit the WordPress dashboard and locate “Plugins” in the left sidebar.

Click “Plugin” and then click “Add New”.

You will see several plugins. Now search for an SEO plugin.

To search for an SEO plugin, write “seo” in the search box. You will see a log list of SEO plugins for WordPress.

Click “Install Now” on the All In One SEO plugin At the top right side.

after completion of installation, the “Install Now” button will convert to “Activate” button, click the button.

How to Set Up WordPress All in one SEO Plugin

After activation of All in one SEO Plugin, you will see a welcome screen.

Click “Let’s Get Start”.

Select the website category on the next page, which can be Blog, News Channel, Online Store, Corporation, or Portfolio.

If your site is not categorized in any of these categories, select Other.

Fill in the homepage title and meta description after selecting a category. Enter a title and description that describe your business properly. The title will be displayed as the link to your website’s home page in SERP. The description will explain your business briefly in search engine results.

Additional Site information

Make sure to use primary keywords (focus keyphrases) in both the title and meta description. This will help to understand search engines and users what your business is about. It will help to improve SEO and CTR.

It’s important to remember that this information pertains to the home page of your website. When creating other individual pages and posts, you have the option to add the title and meta description later.

After completing all the information, click ‘Save and Continue’ to save all changes and move on to the next page.

Choose whether the owner of the website is a person or an organization. If your website is a blog and you manage it, you can select a person.
The next field allows you to select a person’s name and it will retrieve names from WordPress users.
You have the option to include a feature image for social media. When someone shares your website URL on social media, this image will be shown.

If you’re not ready to fill in the information, you can skip this step. You can fill it in later by visiting the All in one SEO plugin dashboard.

There is a list of social media platforms. You can insert a social media link.

Enable SEO features

The next step is the activation of the SEO features of the plugin.

Some features that are recommended for your website category have already been updated. Only make changes to the setting if you have advanced knowledge, otherwise you can leave it.

By default, Optimized Search Appearance and Sitemaps are selected.

Search Appearance

In the search Appearance screen, you can see a snippet preview of your website on the Google search engine result page. You can modify the homepage title and meta description if you want to make any changes.

If your site is not fully completed then you can select Under-construction, It will prevent search engines from crawling your website, otherwise, you can select “Live Site”. 

The next option is “Include all Post Types”. You can leave it default.

The next option is “Enable sitemap”, leave it selected.

If your website has multiple authors select “Yes”,  otherwise select “No”.

At last, leave the Redirect Attachment Page setting on. This setting prevents to index pages on the search engine that are not required to show on the search engines, such as media pages.

When you click “Save and Continue”, you will see a prompt to buy the Pro version to unlock services for image SEO and the smart redirect option.

You can purchase a plan, otherwise you can skip by clicking “I’ll do it later”.

License Key

If you have a pro plan, you can enter a license key.
You can use the free version of the All in one SEO plugin with limited options.

Click Skip, you don’t have the license key.

Setup completion

Finally, to complete the set up click Finish Setup and Go to the Dashboard.

After finishing the last step you will see the All in one SEO plugin dashboard.

You can fill in any skipped information or change the settings of the All in one SEO plugin in the future.
For that go to the All in One SEO link in the left sidebar of WordPress and click General Settings -> Relaunch Setup Wizard

How to Use All in one SEO Plugin for Optimization of Pages and Blog Posts

After you have set up the All in One SEO plugin completely, let’s start optimizing your website’s individual pages and posts.
Now go to the posts and select the post you need to optimize for SEO.
You can see AIOSEO’s setting for optimization at the bottom of the post.
By default, the General tab is selected.

Steps to Optimize WordPress Post

The “Snippet Preview” has already shown the title and meta description, which is a sample of what it will look like on the search engine result page.
The All in One SEO plugin, by default, uses the post title as the meta title and extracts a few lines from the first paragraph as the meta tag description.

On the General tab, you can view the snippet preview, and setup the post title, meta description, focus keyphrase, and additional keyphrases.

Apart from that, you can do page analysis.

You can customize them by editing, to make them more attractive.
Now you will learn them all one by one.

Adding Pre-built Tags

You can add pre-built tags to your post title and description.

Just click the buttons above the title field with the ‘+’ sign, to add a post title, a site title, an author name, a separator, and other tags.

Similarly, click the button, to add a post excerpt, post content, date, author name, and other tags.

Search Engine Snippet Preview of Meta Description and Meta Title

There is also a search engine snippet preview.

 The snippet preview displays a desktop version, by default.

There is also a mobile phone snippet preview.
Click the mobile phone icon in the right top corner to change the snippet preview to mobile view.

Using Content Analyzer to Improve Content Scores For SEO

The All in one SEO plugin has a fantastic function that enables you to enhance your content score.
Writing quality content is crucial for engaging readers. It will help a lot to improve SEO.
In the section Page Analysis, you can find ways to improve your page content scores and engage readers with your content.

Locate the ‘Page Analysis’ section at the bottom of the All in one SEO plugin in the General Tab.

Three tabs Basic SEO, Title, and Readability are visible.

We will discuss each of these individually to improve them.

Improving the Basic SEO

Correcting all the parameters listed in this column will result in the display of ‘All Good’.

Consider the following points to improve basic SEO.

  • For bets result keep meta description Length between 130 to 160 characters. Titles longer than this length will not be visible to the user, Because Google truncates characters over 160.
  • Write 1000 to 2500 words content. Long content is considered good for SEO. Write value content.
  • Add internal links to related posts.
  • Add external links to quality content.

Improving the Title.

To improve the title we need to consider the following points.

  • Title ideal length should be 50-60 characters.
  • Use the Focus Keyword in the title.
  • Add a positive or a negative sentiment word to the title.
  • If possible use a number in the title

Improving the Readability

Readability is very important to improve the engagement of readers. All in one SEO plugin lists some parameters to improve readability. You can write good content by considering these points. These points are as described in pictures below.

By considering the following points, you can improve Readability.

  • Add value to content by using Images/videos in content
  • Keep Paragraph length less than 300 words
  • keep moderate Sentence length.
  • use enough active voice.
  • Use Transition words
  • Use enough variety in your sentences.
  • Also, use Subheading.
  • Good Flesch Reading Ease score

Conclusion

Improving SEO is crucial for driving more traffic to your website. An SEO plugin is a must-have to guide you in improving SEO. An SEO plugin is a tool that helps us check all technical points, even when we forget them.

The All-in One SEO plugin guides us in implementing all of these steps individually without having extensive technical knowledge.

After completing the easy setup wizard, you can utilize its automated feature to enhance SEO. By satisfying specific parameters, you can automatically improve your site’s SEO.

You don’t need to spend more time on SEO, because it saves a lot of time with it’s easy guide. We can make use of that time for other tasks.

The content-guiding feature of the All in one SEO plugin is also very beneficial for writing good content.

This tutorial is designed to teach you how to install and configure the All-in-One SEO plugin and effectively utilize its features.

I hope this article will help you.
