title.rendered: How to Add WordPress Meta Description, Meta Titles, and Focus Keyphrases

content.rendered:
Website SEO plays a crucial role in driving traffic to the website. Many factors influence our website’s SEO.

Meta Description, Meta Title, and Focus Keyphrase (Focus Keywords) are essential components of SEO, and they contribute to improving CTR —these target snippets aid in attracting users and converting them into website visitors.

This article will teach you how to properly use meta descriptions, meta titles, and focus keyphrases.

What is a Meta Description

Meta Description is an HTML element tag that contains a short introduction of page content.

It is very important to provide a summary of a web page to search engines, it enables users to get information about the page’s content.

If the title and meta description satisfy the user’s query, he clicks on the page link to visit the website.

To Improve SEO you also need to learn about meta title and focus keyphrases, these are related to each other.

What is a Focus Keyphrase

Focus Keyphrases are also referred to as focus keywords. Our content is all centered around these words. We use our content to explain and provide answers about these keyphrases.

Google uses key phrases as the primary criteria to search for content for users who initiate searches on Google. When a user types keywords in the search bar, Google compares the content in the database for those keywords. The most relevant content is listed on the result page.

It’s crucial to include key phrases in our content that are naturally linked to our content.

Don’t stuff keywords in content. Make sure to use the appropriate keywords in the content, which are used by users to search for content on Google.

What is a Meta Title

A meta title or title tag is an HTML element in the head section of the page. The purpose of a meta title is to describe the page’s topic in SERPs.

The meta title is not the website name; occasionally, people include the website name in the home page title. It is good to write a title that gives an introduction to the page content.

To describe individual page topics, it’s better to write the title according to page content, and not the same for all pages.

A good meta title of the page attracts the user to click the page link, so it helps to improve CTR. Use key phrases in the page title.

Difference Between Meta Title Tag and H1 Tag, Purpose of Use

To avoid confusion, it’s beneficial to understand the difference between these two.
The meta title is an HTML element that is located in the HEAD section of the HTML page.
It is not visible in the HTML page output or directly on a web page to the user. The user cannot see it at the output of an HTML page or directly on a web page. It is located within the HTML code.

It is only seen on search engine result pages (SERPs) or within the browser tab. Search engines display the page title using a meta tag title.

On the other hand, H1 tags are used to display large text on the page as the page title. WordPress uses it to display post titles. The search engine does not display H1 tags on SERPs .
It’s a good practice to have a meta tag title and H1 tag similar. If someone arrives at your web page or post and sees a page title (H1) different from the one they saw on the search engine result page, it may cause confusion. So he can leave the page.
It is recommended to use only one H1 tag per page or WordPress post.

Importance of Meta Descriptions, Meta Title, and Focus Keyphrase

It is very important to provide a summary of a web page so that visitors may know about the page’s content. The user is more likely to click the website link and visit the webpage if it is related to their query. so it is very helpful for SEO.

If we do not add a meta tag description to the page,  Google may generate it automatically by extracting words from the page. Google’s random generation of descriptions may not be fully aligned with page content, causing us to lose potential visitors to our website or blog.

Users examine meta tag descriptions and meta titles and search focus keyphrases in both.

So we can say all these play an important role in bringing visitors to the web page.

How do Meta Description, Meta Titles, and Focus Keywords Work for SEO?

The primary objective of search engines is to fetch results for users when they make a query on the search engines. Search engines use certain parameters to select the website link for the user’s query. 

Page URLs, titles, keywords (focus keyphrases), and meta tag descriptions are the parameters that comprise these parameters. Search engines compare all these parameters and select the most suitable content for user queries. So meta tag description, titles, and keywords are parameters of selection for the SERP list.

The search engine introduces the page to the user by writing a description of the page. If we add a meta tag description to the page, search engines will display it on SERP; otherwise, search engines will generate a random description that search engines think is most appropriate.

If search engines discover that our description is not relevant to the search keywords, in that case, they also generate descriptions.

So it is very important to add a meta tag description with relevant keywords. 

The user is required to locate a page that is most useful or appropriate for him. The user selects a page by examining the title, description, and keyphrases, which are copies of the website page title and meta tag description.

This is a working process of meta tag description, meta title, and focus keyphrases to bring traffic to our page.

Why add WordPress Meta Tags?

Meta tag description, meta title, and focal keyword all have different functions to improve SEO and CTR.

The meta tag title and meta tag description contain focus keyphrases. These three are closely linked and used to present page content to search engines (search engine crawlers) and users.

These help the search engine to locate your content and present it to the user if your content is appropriate for the user’s query. 

SEO is enhanced by the collaboration of these three. Our discussion will focus on each of the three.

How to Add Meta Description, Meta Title, and Focus Keyphrase?

There are multiple ways to add meta tags to a website.

On a static website, we can add them manually, in the head section of an HTML page. Use the following code:

<head>
<title>This is an example of the meta title tag, include the main keyword in it</title>
<meta name="description" content=" This is an example of meta description, include the main keyword in it"/>
</head>

To generate the meta title and meta description in WordPress, we can either use a plugin or add some code.

The code automatically generates a meta tag title from the post title and a meta tag description from the first paragraph of the post. 

This guide explains how to add meta tags without a plugin.

Using an SEO plugin is the most convenient way to add a focus keyphrase, meta title, and meta tag description in WordPress. 

This method is straightforward and doesn’t require technical expertise in coding.  Plugin provides a step-by-step guide to managing all these things.

Some parameters are used by these plugins for the proper implementation of meta tags from an SEO perspective.

All you need to do is download and install the plugin. Here we will use All in One SEO plugin.

How to Add Meta Description in WordPress Post and Pages?

You can add a meta title while you publish a post, or you can edit a post to add a meta title that is already published.

Adding Meta Description, Meta Title, and Foucus Keyphrase in New Post.

To Add a meta tag description, meta title, and focus keyphrase in the new post simply write your post and navigate to the post bottom. You will see All in One SEO plugin interface.

In the top bar, you can see “General” is selected by default. Leave it selected.

Now you can see the preview snippet; it already displays the title and meta tag description, It is a sample of how it will look on the search engine result page.
In fact, by default, the AIOSEO plugin takes the post title as the meta title and extracts the few lines from the first paragraph as the meta tag description.

We can edit these and make them more attractive by customizing them.

Adding Pre built Tags

You have the option to add pre built tags to your title and description now.
By clicking the buttons above the title field with the ‘+’ sign, you can add a post title, a separator, a site title, an author name, and other tags.

Similarly, by clicking the button, you can add a post excerpt, post content, author name, date, and other tags.

Search Engine Snippet Preview of Meta tag Description and Meta Title

You can see a search engine snippet preview.
By default, the snippet preview displays a desktop version.

You can view the mobile phone snippet preview also.
Change the snippet preview to mobile by clicking the mobile phone icon in the right top corner.

Adding Meta Tags in Old Post.

The procedure is almost the same. If the post is already published, follow the steps as below.

In the WordPress admin sidebar, search for Posts and now click “All Posts”.

Find the post, to add a meta tag title and meta tag description.

Now click Edit.

Navigate to the bottom of the post.

Now the procedure is the same as mentioned in the section: how to add meta tag title, meta tag description, and meta key phrases in a new post.

Best Practice: How to Write a Meta Description

Keep a few things in mind while writing a meta description.

How long should a meta description be?

It have no specific length limit. You should write a description, sufficient to elaborate your page idea to the user.   

Google truncates snippet characters over 155 to 160 to fit in the target device. So it is advisable to specify your main idea in less than 160 characters. Because characters over 160 will not be visible to users.

So meta description length should be less than 160 characters, if not possible try to write the main message under the first 160 characters.

 

Consider Following Point when Write a Meta Description

  1. It must describe page content in brief.  
  2. Explain your idea less than 160 characters because characters over 160 will not be visible to users
  3. Add focus keyphrases to your meta description
  4. Write in an active voice and make it seem actionable to attract visitor
  5. It should be unique.
  6. It is good to add a call to action

Conclusion

Meta tags are essential components of SEO. Without these, it is impossible to improve SEO and CTR.
Before clicking on the page link, the user examines the meta description and meta title. In order to persuade users to click the link, it is essential to include the main keyword accurately in both. The addition of keyphrases increases the CTR.
I hope this article will help you understand and implement all of these correctly to get more traffic to your website.

title.rendered: How to Start a Blog | 9 Steps to Create a Blog to Make You Money (2023)

content.rendered:
Before starting a blog you need to do a little planning So that in the future you do not have to face something that could have been considered in the past.

If you’re here to learn how to start a blog, you must have a basic idea of your blog. You can organize and improve your ideas by reading this guide. And start earning money from home as a passive income or full-time job.

It is a complete guide. If you don’t have any idea where to start, it will help you a lot.

Choose A Suitable Niche

When you start a blog, the topic you share is your niche. Your niche is the area of knowledge you have to write about.

Choosing your niche is the first important step. Choosing your blog’s niche requires answering two questions.

1. In which subject do you have a strong interest and enjoy discussing?

Choosing a niche in which you are interested and have knowledge would be the best option. You can easily become an expert in that area without putting in too much effort.

Starting a blog in a niche with low knowledge is not impossible, you just need to work hard.

Your interest in the niche is the most significant aspect. Choosing a niche without an interest is not a good idea, it’s best to get inspiration from others.

Visit blogs that are similar to your interests to gain insight into what knowledge you require, how to enhance it, and how to present it. This will also help you choose a potential niche.

2. Are more people finding the same topic on the internet?

Is there a substantial amount of people willing to learn about the topic?

Additionally, more individuals are discovering the same information on the internet.

Google is an excellent place to inquire about this. If it shows more results, then you can write about the topic.

Technology, travel, fashion, food, gaming, and other topics are just a few examples of topics.

If you’re not sure what you want, you can start a blog about your favorite topic. The most important thing is to start something because you’ll learn things after spending some time on them.

Choosing A Blog Name

Choosing your blog name or domain name is the next step. Your blog’s name is used by people to remember it and search for it. It’s possible that it will become your brand after some time.

Pick a name that is catchy. To pick a blog name, take into account your niche; it’s more beneficial if it’s connected to it. There are advantages and disadvantages to linking your blog name to a specific niche.

The advantage is that your blog name will help people understand your content. The drawback is that you must write for a specific niche and cannot expand or change your topic. 

Pick a name that is not too specific, easy to remember, and sticks in the visitor’s mind when they see it.

Take a pen and paper or open a notepad, search for words that relate to your subject of interest, and create some combinations.

Try a handful of word combinations until one sticks out to you. 

Catchy words can be used as prefixes and post-fixes in combination, such as i, 10x, fast, beast, boom, boost, box, buzz, tech, town, treat, tribe, or tricks.

Collect 9 to 10 such combinations and examine them using the domain checker tool.

I suggest you avoid using your name as a domain name because it could sound like a personal site since there are few people who know you and your profession. If you’re not a celebrity, it may have different meanings for different people. Only use your name as a domain if it’s a brand and you’re very well-known.

When selecting a domain name, take into account certain factors.

  • For Domain extension TLDs(Top-Level Domains), Your first choice should be .com because it has more authority in the minds of the people. The second choice may be .net,.biz, etc.
  • You can also try country-specific names like .ca, .us, co.uk, or .in if your blog presents information about a specific country or area.
  • Don’t use too many numbers in the domain name. It may be confusing when typing the name. The domain name should be easy to type and pronounce.
  • Avoid selecting names that have the same pronunciation but differ in spelling.
  • Avoid selecting names that have the same pronunciation but differ in spelling.
  • Short names are better, with 4-5 characters and a maximum of 10 characters. Easy to spell and remember.
  • The use of hyphens is controversial because some say it is good for SEO but difficult for typing.

Choosing A Platform For Blogging

To start a blog, you have to use a CMS.  A content management system(CMS) is software that handles your blog and generates new pages and other items according to your settings. You can use different themes to change its look. It’s not a complicated process, so don’t get confused. Soon, you will be familiar with all of these things.

WordPress, Wix, Drupal, Blogger, and Pixapa are all blogging platforms.

WordPress is one of the most famous among them. Over 63% of the CMS market is dominated by WordPress. WordPress is my preferred platform because it is a user-friendly, free, and trustworthy one. There are more resources available, including free themes and plugins to use. A large number of tutorials and materials about WordPress can be found on Google. It has a large community.

WordPress can be installed without any technical knowledge by almost every hosting company with a single click. You can also use Wizzard to install it.

You can also install plugins for enhanced capabilities of WordPress service.

Installing WordPress

Sign in to your hosting account Cpanel.

Navigate to bottom of cPanel to “Scripts” Section.

Now click WordPress icon shown as picture below

This will show A new screen.

Now Click “Install Now”.

Now fill in information about your blog.

Your domain URL and Latest version are selected by default.

Enter your Site Name and Site Description as shown in the picture below.

Now fill in your email address and click install

Your installation will begin now. It could take a few seconds or a few minutes. You can now customize your WordPress blog to meet your needs.

Selecting a WordPress Theme to Change the Blog’s Look and Design

A WordPress theme consists of code files and media files that define the style and design of a WordPress website or blog. The default theme for WordPress is quite simple.

You can easily change the design of your blog by changing the theme. Select the theme in the WordPress dashboard, download it, install it, and activate it. Thousands of themes are available in the WordPress theme library. Both free and paid themes are available.

The theme can be changed at any time with ease. Your website’s appearance will be altered, but the data will remain intact. The content of your post will remain the same; a different theme will alter the design of the blog.

All posts are automatically fitted based on the design.

Let’s learn how to change themes in easy steps.

Logging into the WordPress dashboard is necessary to make changes or create a post. The WordPress Dashboard can be accessed by entering the URL yourdomain.com/wp-admin in the browser bar. Replace yourdomain.com with your own domain name.

After that, you will see this login screen.

After successful login, you will see the WordPress Dashboard

Step 1. Now search for Appearance in the left sidebar and click it.
Step 2. Now Click Add New at the top of the dashboard in front of Themes.

There are numerous themes to choose from. Choosing a theme is a difficult task because all themes are beautiful. You will be locked in Squirrel Syndrome.

To overcome this situation, you can use the Feature Filter button.

In the next picture, you will see, there are three vertical columns. In the “subject” column you can choose a blog as you are searching theme for a blog. In ‘feature’, you can choose according to your preference, for example, a custom head. The ‘layout’ column allows you to select the blog layout.
These filters only display themes based on selected features. This will be very helpful in narrowing down your theme options list.

After selecting your options, Click Apply Filters.

You will see several themes which will be suitable for your needs. There will be a huge list.

Clicking on the theme thumbnail will provide a quick preview of the theme’s design and look. It will demonstrate how your blog will look after using this theme.

If the theme appeals to you, you can click on the install button at the top left side of the preview window inside the red box. Once the installation is finished, the Install button will turn into an activate button.

To activate the theme, click the ‘activate’ button inside red the box in picture below.

If the theme doesn’t suit you, you can repeat the process and choose a different one.

Blog Theme Customization

Once the theme has been selected and activated, the next step is to customize it to meet the needs of our blog and make it unique for our domain.
Although there are several customization options, we will only discuss the ones that are mandatory for a blog. The blog title and logo setup are mandatory. We can make other customizations at a later time.


To begin the customization process go “Appearance” in left sidebar, click the ‘Customize’ button on your current theme.

As shown in the picture below, you will see a customization screen.

Different themes may have some differences in the sidebar menu options. The ‘Site Identity’ is the main option that needs to be changed.

Click the “Site Identity” option in left sidebar.

In the next screen, you can add the blog title, blog tagline, and upload the blog logo.

As shown in the picture below, you can fill in the information.
To upload the blog logo, click on ‘Select Logo’. Once you click, a media library will appear where you can upload the logo of your blog or website.

Then you can also change the size of the logo from “Logo Size”.

The site title is the next step. Type in your blog’s title or name.

Fill in the tagline of your blog or business after that.

To upload the icon of your blog or website, click on ‘Select site icon’ at the end. When someone opens your blog or website in the browser, this icon is displayed in the browser tab.

At last, Must click the “Publish” button to save all changes; otherwise, all the changes you made will be lost.

Keep in mind that there may be some differences in appearance, but the options will almost be the same. Don’t stick with this look, it’s only a guide on how to start a blog and add information about it.

Search Engine Optimization of the Blog

Search Engine Optimization (SEO) is an important component of blog setup.
The objective of SEO is to ensure that search engines can locate our content and send traffic to our blog.

The earning potential of our blog depends on the amount of traffic it receives. Search engines help a lot to drive traffic to our blog.

Visitors search on Google by typing specific words to find content. These words are referred to as keywords. Our goal is to write for these keywords so that Google index our blog for these keyword content and send traffic to our blog.

Writing content about these keywords is necessary, but we also need to make technical changes to our blog to alert Google that our blog has content for these keywords.
Even though dealing with technical issues may seem difficult, WordPress has options to make it effortless by using SEO WordPress plugins.

To Install SEO plugins, visit the WordPress dashboard and locate “Plugins” in the left sidebar.

Click “Plugin” and then click “Add New”.

You will see several plugins. Now search for an SEO plugin.

To search for an SEO plugin, write “seo” in the search box. You will see a log list of SEO plugins for WordPress.

At the top, there are three primary SEO plugins that are well-known for SEO. Yoast SEO, Rank Math SEO, and All in One SEO are all good options that you can use.

There are free features available in these plugins to use. For additional functionality, you have the option to purchase paid versions. Their free versions are also very useful for SEO.
In order to use the SEO plugins, click ‘install’ and then ‘activate’.

To enhance the WordPress blog SEO, you need to make some adjustments after installing the SEO plugin.

How to Write a Blog Post and Publish it

It’s time to publish a post after all the WordPress setup work has been completed. Let’s create content for your blog.

Log in to the WordPress dashboard. Find ‘Posts’ in the left sidebar and click on it.

You can see that the Hello Word post is already there. It is a default post that comes with the installation, and it is intended to show a sample of the post.. We don’t require it, so remove it. Click on ‘Trash’ under the post.

Click on ‘Add New’ to create a new post.

The post editor screen is visible to you. Enter your post title in the title box (replace Add Title with your post title).

As you can see in the next picture I have added the title How to start a blog

Under the title box, you can see ‘Type/to choose a block’. You can insert the content of the post in this text box, and use the “+” sign to change the type of text entered in this box.

To enter additional content text, click outside of these text boxes, and a ‘+’ will appear. To enter text, simply click on this “+” sign.
After clicking the “+” sign, you will see a Selection box.

Use this selection box to select Heading(H1, H2, H3, H4, H5, H6), Paragraph, Image, Gallery, List, Quote, and many more text formatting attributes to organize the content of the post.
Every time you can create new headings, upload images, create new paragraphs, list, and so on.

Now after adding your post content click the “Publish” button at the right side on the top. After clicking one time you have to click it second time to publish the post.

Next Step After Learning: How to Start a Blog

I hope you have found the answer to the question of how to start a blog. The main objective of the blog is to generate income. To achieve that, it is necessary to offer value to your readers in your content. If you provide good content, they can indirectly help you. They will bookmark and share your content with other people. This is a factor in improving SEO and ultimately generating more traffic.

title.rendered: What is SEO Strategy |  SEO Content Strategy with 6 Point to get More Traffic.

content.rendered:
To obtain traffic in times of high competition, we must develop a good SEO strategy. Some SEO Content Strategies are closely related and have a great impact on each other. We are aware of the following initial points:

Adding websites to search engines.

This step is initial and simple.  We can index our website or blog by submitting it to the Google search console and Bing search engine.

The next step is to put in some effort to generate a small amount of traffic.

After achieving a small amount of traffic, the next step is to engage the reader with our content. This will give a signal to Google that our content is quality content.

It will enhance our rank in the SERPs. As a result, we will see a significant increase in traffic.

Now this is a circle, where one step depends on the other, and we have to enter it. Entering the circle is a challenge for new blogs and websites.

Here we will discuss a couple of things to make it easier. We will acquire knowledge on how to enter the circle and maintain our position.

Keyword Research as Part of SEO Content Strategy

A keyword is a single word or group of words that we type on the search engines to make a search for a topic and to find a solution.

To create content for a blog or website, the first crucial step is to find keywords that are related to our content and are also searched by users on search engines. This is the main pillar of content, search engines find content on the internet according to the keywords typed by the users.

If we make understand search engines that we have the best content for the keyword, then search engines will list our content at a higher rank.

A keyword is also known as a focus keyphrase. Search engines usually search for a keyword or a key phrase in the title and description to find the content for user queries.
Search engine indexing uses natural occurrences of keywords in content to rank it.
The main criterion for finding content for search queries is the keyword.

You can see this in the above search engine result page picture. The word ‘Page Speed’ is highlighted in the search. It is the main keyword of the query.

So it is important to find the best keyword for our content

We have to find a keyword that has a high volume but a low difficulty level, but it is impossible. Because all content creators create content for the keyword that is most searched, More content for a keyword makes its difficulty level high. It is more difficult to rank for such a keyword.

But there are some other things that we can use in high competition as help in SEO Strategy. We will learn in the next section.

Create Quality Content as part of the SEO Content Strategy

It is important to create a high relation between keywords and content.

SEO is not possible without good content. To engage users with blog posts, it is crucial to write high-quality content. Quality content solves the reader’s problem. Good content addresses the user intent for which they clicked your link in the SERP. It must be centered around your title and main keyword.

It must be deep enough for users to feel satisfied with your content. This will enhance the user experience. 

Here is a picture for AIOSEO plugin show good SEO Content qualities. For detail you can learn AIOSEO plugin tutorial for Content quality as SEO strategy.

An article with 1500 to 2300 words is considered good. But don’t stuff the content with irrelevant sentences and repeat the same information; it may irritate readers and cause them to leave your article.

To write good content, it’s crucial to choose a niche and gain a thorough understanding of it. To explain something, you must have good knowledge about the subject. This is the most important requirement for good content writing.

It’s important to properly represent content. Organize the related information into paragraphs. A paragraph should be focused on a specific sub-task. Divide large information into small multiple paragraphs. Always try to make short paragraphs. It makes the reader comfortable to read.

Make your content catchy by adding a catchy description at the start of your article.

Describe the primary issue and the method for solving it.

Website Indexing as an SEO Strategy

It is very important to index your website in search engines. Indexing your website in the Google Search Console is the most important thing. Google Search Console provides tools that help to analyze website data, that are crucial for SEO Strategy.

 It provides reports on stats like broken links, CTR, total impressions, how many pages in your blog are indexed, the accessibility of your website on Google, etc.

Social Media Marketing for Web Traffic as a Part of SEO Strategy

It’s really hard for a new website or a new blog to get traffic from search engines. But the traffic is really important for SEO and showing our content.

The second option to obtain traffic initially is a social media platform.

However, more than 80% of blogs indeed increase traffic using social media marketing.

The first step is to choose the appropriate social media platform.  Concentrating on too many platforms is not a good thing. For example, Pinterest is good for getting traffic for blogs; Facebook is also used to get traffic, but it has a restriction of a minimum number of followers to add links for websites and blogs; a similar restriction is also with Instagram; and both Instagram and TikTok are more appropriate for influencer marketing. B2B companies can benefit from LinkedIn.

After choosing a social platform, create an account or page that aligns with your niche. 

Do your research, and remain consistent. Make sure to share your blog posts regularly. Sharing great content can help to engage followers. They will share your content with others. It will begin a cycle to boost your followers.

The presence of these followers will lead to an increase in your web traffic. This traffic provides you with the opportunity to show your content and access to search engine traffic.

Because traffic from the social media platform will give a signal to search engines that your content is quality content.

Page Experience Importance for SEO Content Strategy

Page experience is very important as an SEO Strategy. It is about how users feel about your website. It includes the mobile usability of the website, core web vitals, HTTPS, etc.

We will be explaining all of it one by one.

Mobile-friendly websites present information on a mobile screen in a way that makes it easy to view and find information.

Core web vitals represent the loading performance, interactivity, and visual stability of the page as part of the user experience. The explanation for these points is as follows:

Largest Contentful Paint(LCP):

It represents how much time it takes to display your page’s largest component. The LCP must be less than 2.5 seconds to provide a good user experience. This maximum delay should be 2.5 seconds from start to finish of the load.

Interactivity

A website is interactive if it is responsive to the actions of users and acts according to their activities. This type of communication is between the user and the website. An example of interaction is, the user clicks on an element and, as a response, the website moves forward or backward and makes any other changes. The user action may cause some visual changes. Other examples include user comments on a post and feedback to comments, clicking internal links for navigation, viewing a video, and so on.

HTTPS is used to ensure the connection’s security

Core web vitals also include user data security during communication by establishing a secure link between the client and server. It is necessary to use a secure HTTP version, which is HTTPS, for that purpose. Data encryption is done before transmission between the client and server in this type of connection. It ensures the security of user data on the internet.

Backlinks as a Good SEO Strategy

Backlinks also play an important role in SEO Strategy . Backlinks to your blog build reputation and trust. It is off-page SEO. 

To obtain baklinks to your blog, it’s important to write good content in-depth. If you write in-depth and the content is unique, other websites will add a link to your article, on their website to provide value to their readers. 

 Don’t buy links it would hurt your SEO ranking. Backlinks from authoritative websites that have related content to your content are the best option.

title.rendered: What is Technical SEO, How To Improve 7 Part of Technical SEO

content.rendered:
Technical SEO describes technical changes to your website so that it improves page ranking in SERP to get more traffic.

Technical SEO aims to present your website content to search engines and index it properly. 

Technical SEO also improves user experience.

Search engines, specifically Google, give a lot of importance to the user experience.

Why is Technical SEO Important

Our primary objective is to attract traffic to our website, which could be a blog, an e-commerce site, or a company.

If we have good content, but it’s not indexed by the search engines, nobody will find it, and everything will go to waste. Because search engines are the major source of traffic.

Technical SEO is very important to add some attributes to our website which help to list our website content on search engines.

What is a Technical SEO Audit?

A technical SEO audit involves reviewing various technical elements of a website to ensure they follow search optimization best practices. This refers to technical aspects of your blog or website that affect the ranking factors of search engines such as Google or Bing.

Use of HTTPS for technical SEO

HTTP (Hypertext Transfer Protocol) is a protocol used to exchange data between clients (web browsers) and servers. HTTP is not secure; anyone can intercept data. To solve this problem, an encrypted version of HTTP called HTTPS( Hypertext Transfer Protocol Secure) is used. HTTPS uses SSL for data encryption.

Benefits of HTTPS

Protecting sensitive information such as login information and credit card details is mandatory.

To protect your data, Google prefers websites with SSL and use HTTPS to transfer data. The majority of international users are aware of the significance of HTTPS for security. Most browsers alert you if a website doesn’t use HTTPS. Thus, users avoid opening websites that do not use SSL.

HTTPS is seen as a positive user experience.

HTTPS is very important for SEO.

If a website uses SSL, the browser displays a lock sign.

Ensure the Page’s Accessibility Through a Single URL to Avoid Duplicate Content Issues.

Ensure that only one copy of website pages is accessible, otherwise, your website will be considered to have duplicate content.

Google dislikes duplicate content on a blog or website. The user experience is negatively impacted by it. 

If you do not publish duplicate content on your website, you should also take care of some technical points to prevent it from looking like duplicate content.

Google treats the following links as separate and will index both pages as different content. Both URLs have the same content now.

“https://yourwebsite.com”
“https://www.yourwebsite.com”

If your website is accessible through both URLs, Google will treat it as duplicate content. According to Google, it does not penalize websites with such duplicate content, but it certainly lowers the site’s rank in the SERP.

Moreover, it will be harder to evaluate the performance of your website or blog in the Google search console.

Here we need to use technical SEO techniques to prevent this situation. 

Adjust your hosting to use only one version (with or without www) for your website. Make sure the other version is redirected to your main website.

If you have SSL, make sure that the server uses HTTPS only and not HTTP.

Improve website loading speed

The website loading speed is a very important point in technical referencing. If a website takes longer than 2.5 seconds to load, visitors will leave the website. 

To improve website speed and SEO, take the following steps.

Optimize images. Images are an important part of a web page. It is also a part of a web page that has the maximum size.  As a result, the speed of the website is reduced. So it is important to reduce image size.

Online services are available to reduce image sizes. We can also convert our images to WEBP format, which is very useful for reducing the image size.

Use Lazy Load for Images. Lazy load is a technique in which only required images are loaded, which are needed to show on a mobile or desktop screen. Other images that are out of the viewport(screen) are loaded as we scroll to change the viewport.

Use a CDN (Content Delivery Network). A CDN is used to save images and other files of your website on different servers at different locations. Your website will serve files from the nearest server when someone opens it.

As a result, it helps to increase website loading speeds.

Compress or minify CSS and JavsScript files: By minifying files, we can reduce the size of CSS, JavaScript, and HTML files. We can use some software to minimize files by removing unnecessary lines, characters, and whitespace.

The Importance of Website Loading Speed for SEO.

Test Your Web Page Speed.

Develop a responsive mobile-friendly website

After detaching the target device, a responsive website loads code to render pages according to the device. A website that is mobile-friendly efficiently generates UI and view for mobile devices. It enhances the user experience on a mobile device. And it’s good for SEO. According to Google, it will give priority to websites in SERPs that are responsive and mobile-friendly.

Google Search Console has a tool to check for mobile-friendliness.

How to create mobile friendly website, best Techniques.

Use of Structured data on pages

Structured data facilitates Google Search Engines to understand the content of a page in a better way. It helps Google figure out the content of your page. If Google understands our content, it will display our content on the search result page in a better way. 

structured data also high lite content efficiently on the SERP. Rich snippets are a part of structuring data. Rich snippets are more appealing in search results, with additional information appearing under the title and description.

Structured data is very important for SEO enhancement. It helps to improve CTR (click-through rate).

Rich snippets can be generated using structured data markup code. Structured data markup code is used to display rich snippets.

Remove duplicate content

If you have multiple copies of the same or almost similar content on your website. It is considered duplication. There are other forms of duplicate content as well.

Linking to the same page in different categories is an instance of duplicate content.

“https://example.com/seo/wordpress-seo” 

“https://example.com/wordpress-mantenace/wordpress-seo”

Even though there is no penalty from Google, it is still harmful to your website’s SEO. There are also some unintentional causes of duplicate pages on our website, for example.

Printable versions of pages are indexed.

The website is accessible with the wrong URL because of the wrong domain setting.

Pages are saved in two categories.

Other issues with duplicate content

It increases the unnecessary load of crawling on the website. Sometimes these pages also come up in search results, but they are not required.

Importance of Core Web Vitals

Page loading speed is also described in terms of LCP.

Largest Contentful Paint (LCP): It should take less than 2.5 seconds, which means the largest content on the page must be painted in less than 2.5 seconds.

Interactivity: It states that the page should be responsive to user actions, videos, and so on.

Also, there should be a low FID (first input delay), which is the time taken to react to user interaction by a webpage.

Cumulative Layout Shift (CLS) is a measurement of the shifts in various elements’ layouts of a webpage.

HTTPS: We already discussed that it is mandatory to transfer sensitive data online between the client (browser) and server.

title.rendered: WordPress SEO Guide for Beginners (Step by Step)

content.rendered:
You have put in a lot of effort to create your WordPress blog. If you haven’t spent some time on WordPress SEO, then you may not get traffic to your blog.
To reward your hard work or earn the benefit of your hard work, it is necessary to spend this little time.
In this article, Our focus is on simple SEO steps that can increase traffic to your blog. You will gain knowledge about the best practices for a WordPress blog. The arrangement of steps is based on how we set up WordPress.

Steps for WordPress SEO

SEO is a simple technique, it only takes a few steps to optimize your content. If you are using WordPress, you have done half the work. Just Keep the following points in your mind. You will feel some improvement in your ranking soon.

Creating Dedicated pages for categories.

Arranging Categories in Pages WordPress lets you categorize your blog posts.
With WordPress, you can sort your blog into categories and tags.

If you have more topics on your blog, it’s best to divide your posts into different categories.

Sort all posts that are related to a specific type into a specific category.
If your niche has sub-niches, create a dedicated page for your sub-niches.

This will enhance the user experience (UX). Additionally, it will improve the organization of your posts. It facilitates the indexing of your posts by search engines. Your website will have good interlinking and a better view of search engines. It will improve your SEO.

For instance, if your website is about blogging and has three topics, such as
Article Writing,
WordPress for blogging,
blogger for blogging.
You can categorize these topics into three categories. Further, you can divide these categories into subcategories like “Writing Tools” and “Writing Techniques” for article writing. Divide “WordPress for Blogging” into “WordPress Setup” and “WordPress SEO”. Divide “Blogger for blogging” into “Blogger Setup” and “Blogger SEO”.
Next, you have to create a dedicated page for each category. For example, create three pages, blogging, WordPress, and Blogger
These pages can now be optimized for more specific keywords. It will be of great use for SEO rankings.

Use of the WordPress SEO plugin

SEO plugins are extremely important for WordPress SEO. It makes it effortless for us to perform SEO tasks. There are several plugins that can be used for referencing.
These plugins have a charge. Buying a plan may be challenging for beginners. These plugins also offer free features that are very helpful for users in improving SEO.
There are some popular SEO plugins that we can use.

The logical URL structure for SEO

A logical URL structure is beneficial for the user’s experience.
A URL that is SEO-friendly is one that contains keywords related to content and is simple and easy to read.

For example, a page containing information about WordPress SEO should look like this:
https://it10.com/wordpress-seo-guide
This link will encourage searchers to click it if they want to learn WordPress SEO. The reason for this is that the link is straightforward and means “WordPress SEO”. Now, it will contribute to an increase in CTR.

This link is also indicating to Google or other search engines that it has the keywords ‘WordPress’ and ‘SEO’, and the search will convert it to ‘WordPress SEO’.
So whenever search engines crawl the website, they index it in their database in a related category for searchers.

Good practice for URL structuring

Use SSL. Secure Sockets Layer encrypts. It will use the HTTPS version instead of HTTP.

It’s recommended to use relevant 2-3 words, with a maximum of four words URLs. Don’t overload the URL with more keywords, as it may be considered spam.Use hyphens instead of underscores. For example, https://it10.com/wordpress-seo-guide
It’s a simple task to complete in WordPress, just follow the steps.
The following is a method for checking and updating the permalink structure of your WordPress site:
Click Settings and then Permalinks.
Select “post name” as an option and to save the setting click on the “Save Changes” button.
picture

Benefits of Internal Links

Internal linking is very helpful to improve your WordPress blog’s SEO. It has two advantages: First, you can provide referrals to a topic for readers. This is good for user experience. Second, users will spend more time on your blog. It will increase the engagement of visitors with your content. It will also boost your page views and improve the reach of other pages.

Because of these reasons, Google gives some credit for internal links and considers your blog content as reachable content.

Make sure to include internal links at the end of the post, so that the reader can continue to the next topic after reading the first one. If it is necessary to include a link in the post for reference, make sure that the link opens in a new tab. This will make it easy for the reader to return to the main topic after viewing references to the term.

Generally, include links to 2-3 previous blog posts in your post. In the beginning, it will be difficult because of the lack of content. You need to keep one thing in mind: link to related content or posts; irrelevant links spoil the user experience and are not good for the user experience.

Internal links can also be created using SEO plugins.

Google Search Console Submission and Benefits

Google provides a free service to web owners, It is called Google Search Console.

The former name for Google Search Console was Webmaster Tool. It is a very useful tool for web owners. It enables Google’s search engine to index your website. Google Search takes a considerable amount of time to discover and index your website if you don’t submit it to the Google Search Console.

In addition to site submission, it provides many tools to provide valuable information to webmasters. It helps to analyze statistics and improve your site’s position in search engine results pages (SERP).

The tool’s primary objective is to help website owners improve their content by providing search statistics. This information is very useful to identify problems and fix them.

The performance report displays the number of times a webpage appears in a search result (impressions) and the number of times the page’s URL is clicked (total clicks). Additionally, it displays the average CTR, the average position of your website in search results, a list of external links to websites, broken links, and pages with a 404 error, etc.

Website SEO can be greatly improved with the help of these statistics. Based on these reports, we can modify our strategy.

In addition to Google Search Console, we should also submit our website to Bing, Yahoo, DuckDuckGo, and other similar sites. 

After registering in Google Search Console, we need to submit our website’s XML sitemap.

In the XML Sitemap section, you will learn how to create XML Sitemap and submit it to Google Search Console.

Creating and Submitting XML sitemaps to the Google Search Console

An XML sitemap is a file created using Extensible Markup Language (XML) that is both human-readable and machine-readable. Search engines use XML sitemap to understand website structure.
It helps to index all your pages quickly with the Google search engine. Otherwise, Google will take a long time to find your website pages.

How to generate XML sitemap.
There are several free services to generate XML sitemaps online. The WordPress SEO plugin can be used to automatically generate an XML site map. Go to the plugin’s site map setting option. Generate an XML sitemap, and after creating the XML sitemap, copy the sitemap link. Submit the sitemap link to Google Search Console. The site map link looks like this: http://yourwebsitename.com/sitemap.xml

The importance of visitor comments for SEO.

Visitor comments improve the engagement of visitors with your blog. They ask questions because they think your blog is authentic.

Let us know how it benefits our article content and SEO.
Visitors ask genuine questions that are related to your content.
Their inquiries are seeking solutions to problems that are not addressed in your article. Answering these questions can be very beneficial for other visitors.

Thus, comments help to add more useful content and add value to your article. It helps to improve the user’s experience. It indirectly enhances the SEO of your blog.

Eliminating spam from comments

Comments are very helpful for our blog’s SEO. But spam comments harm our blog’s SEO. So it is mandatory to eliminate spam comments. These spammy comments also slow down your WordPress blog.

You may delete these unwanted comments while replying to genuine comments. Having a large number of comments makes it impossible.

To resolve this problem, you can use anti-spam WordPress plugins.

For example, Akismet, Jetpack, Antispam Bee, and Anti-spam are the plugins that can prevent spam.

These plugin filters work based on some rules; therefore, they can filter genuine comments if they find something not according to their rules. But that comment may be valuable for your readers and search engines.

To solve this problem, it is possible to locate these genuine comments in the trash and restore them.

Importance of secure URLs for SEO

It’s crucial to use HTTPS instead of HTTP, which is a secure version of URLs, by incorporating SSL (Secure Sockets Layer) certificates.

In this version, data is encrypted prior to being exchanged on the Internet between a website and a server.

Using SSL on a website ensures that user data is safe when transmitted over the internet.
It is impossible for anyone to intercept data and extract information from it. If the web browser displays a look icon on the left side of the address bar and the URL prefix starts with HTTPS instead of HTTP, it indicates that the website uses SSL. The browser flags a website as insecure if it doesn’t use SSL.

It will enhance visitor trust in your website. Google also recommends to use of SSLs. Websites that don’t use SSLs are ranked lower by Google in the SERP. Google takes care of visitors and doesn’t compromise the security of users.
Using SSL is considered a great user experience. SEO is greatly influenced by SSLs.

Some useful options in WordPress.

Before we launch our website, it’s important to change some settings in WordPress.

Discouraging search engines from indexing the site.

One option is used to discourage search engines from indexing your website site.
The purpose of this is to prevent search engines from crawling and indexing our site until we establish a WordPress website or blog properly.
We don’t want search engines indexing our pages that are not proper or the website is not structured properly.

You can check this option to discourage search engines when you don’t have proper content.

But you must ensure to uncheck this option after a proper setup and adding content to the website, to allow search engines to crawl your WordPress blog.

To change the option follow the steps.

Settings -> Reading -> Search engine visibility (Check Box Discourage search engines from indexing this site)

Saving Post In Draft

We can also save our Posts in draft until we refine their content properly. You can also view it in this mode. And publish it when you complete your post-refinement.

title.rendered: 10 Crucial WordPress Maintenance Tasks For SEO and Security.

content.rendered:
Do you know WordPress maintenance is a crucial factor to gain traffic for your blog? It is the second important step after starting a blog.

You may not receive potential benefits or face serious losses if you are unaware of how to perform WordPress Maintenance.

In this article, you will learn how to promote your blog by doing a WordPress Maintenance task.

Why is WordPress Maintenance Tasks Important.

WordPress maintenance can benefit our blog by ensuring a smooth run and improving SEO, this results in an increase in traffic to our blog. SEO and the smooth running of the blog are closely related. Moreover, it contributes to enhancing security and user experience.
To ensure smooth run of the WordPress blog, we need to perform tasks like security checks, backups, and deleting unnecessary material.

It is a normal continuous process. Next, we will learn step by step.

WordPress Backup and Restoration

Backup should be at the top of the priority list of WordPress maintenance tasks.
I won’t say that you need to take backup daily or weekly. The frequency of backups depends on certain factors. It is good to take backup every time you write a new post or updated an old post. It may be daily, weekly, or monthly.

It’s beneficial to have multiple copies of the backup in different locations.

Before we move forward, we need to understand a few basic things.

A WordPress blog consists of files and a database.
i ) Files: The WordPress theme and plugin files.
ii) Database: posts, comments, metadata

A proper backup must include both WordPress files and the database backup. The backup of the database is more important.
If anything goes wrong, we can recover the blog by installing WordPress and plugins again, which may be a little time-consuming but not impossible. But in case of database loss, it is very harmful because writing content is difficult and even impossible.

Different ways to back up a WordPress blog.

Manually backup using FTP and phpMyAdmin

We use phpMyAdmin to download database files in this method. To save WordPress files and images on our local storage, we use FTP.

You can find phpAdmin in cPanel and download your database. for complete steps visit the tutorial WordPress Backup.

Hosting backups

There is also an option within CPanel to back up. But you should not rely upon hosting backups. As you don’t have enough control over them, these may fail to restore your blog.

WordPress Backup Plugin for backup

As it is a simple and easy method, this method is suitable for beginners.

There are several plugins for WordPress backups, some of them are UpdraftPlus, Duplicator, BackWPup, BlogVault, and BackupBuddy. The process of WordPress backups is automated by these plugins.

These plugins store backups to Google Drive or Dropbox. All you have to do is check the backup manually and should learn how to restore the backup when necessary.

Check the backups frequently because sometimes the plugin may not backup, so that in such cases you can take the necessary measures.

The Security of a WordPress Blog as WordPress Maintenance Task

Security is the most important factor in WordPress maintenance. We can save our data by backups. However, security is required to prevent some other non-desirable consequences. Before an attack takes place on our WordPress blog, we should be aware that it could slow down our WordPress blog, spoil the user experience, and decrease our search rankings.

To prevent any mishaps, we need to take proactive measures.

The protection of passwords.

When security is at stake, there are never enough options available. To gain access, hackers use a list of commonly used usernames and passwords and apply the hit-and-trial method to crack passwords. It is called a brute-force attack.

Apart from that They also use scripts that try thousands of combinations to crack the password.

Avoid the use of easy passwords, which can be found in lists of common usernames and passwords that have been leaked on the web. In addition to preventing all these things, change your password frequently and use a strong, unique, long password with a special character combination that can prevent access to your blog by brute force attacks. Remove accounts that are not in use.

Use of a security plugin.

These plugins scan your WordPress and add some additional day-to-day protection. Set frequency of scan at least once a month. There are a few security plugins below you can use.

  • WordFence Security
  • All In One WP Security & Firewall

you can also use the free service Sucuri Sitecheck to check your WordPress blog

lock-down your WordPress admin login.

It is also a good measure to change your login so that it would not be accessible to malicious attackers and hackers.
Hiding the login URL of your WordPress site is very helpful to protect from brute force attacks, hacks, and random attacks. It will be hard for Hackers and malicious attackers access your login if it is changed.

The easiest way to change the location of the WP login is to use The WPS Hide Login plugin. It allows you to change the location of login WordPress without rewriting any files. It intercepts the login request and redirected to the location of your choice.
Its additional advantages are that it is very light, It does not rewrite any rule or alter any file. It is also free.
It’s also compatible with other plugins, as Limit Login Attempts, BuddyPress, User Switching plugins, and bbPress.

Updating WordPress core, theme, and plugins

Another important WordPress maintenance task is to update the WordPress core, theme, and plugins.

New functions added by developers can be utilized by updating these elements.
New versions are important as they remove errors and faults detected in older versions and as a result more stable and secure. This is ultimately beneficial for both user experience and website SEO.

Over time, older versions become outdated and can be compromised by hackers and malware.
So to prevent such threats, we should update new versions.

Let us not forget that we should use a stable version if we are not experts.
Updating WordPress is a simple process. An update icon will appear on top of the dashboard at the left side of the comments icon when there are new releases for WordPress. As shown in the image below.

Click it now.
You will see the dashboard will show the details of all updates, just click on them and update.

One thing you should keep in mind is to back up your WordPress blog whenever you update anything. If a problem occurs, a recent backup can be used to restore it.

Removal of Broken links as WordPress Maintenance.

Broken link removal is also an important part of WordPress maintenance.

Broken links are links that point to pages that are either not present or have been moved.
Broken links can be either external or internal. As the blog grows, the chance of broken links increases.

Broken links can be caused by multiple factors. It is possible that a target page to be deleted, a page to be changed or moved, or the link to point to the wrong page. The URL is either incorrect or misspelled.

Broken links have negative consequences.

Poor user experience:

A 404 error is displayed when a visitor clicks on a broken link. The 404 error page irritates the visitor and creates a bad user experience. This creates a negative impression in the visitor’s mind, which will prevent them from returning to your website. indirectly It also down your blog SEO.

Negative effect on SEO:
Search engines navigate your website through internal links. Broken links prevent search engines to navigate your WordPress blog. it will hurt your blog’s SEO.

How to identify and remove broken links.

As a result of the broken links, you can lose your blog traffic. By checking for broken links, you can easily avoid this situation.

The following methods can help you identify broken internal links on your website.

Manually checking broken links is an option, but it’s a tedious task for a large blog or may be impossible. This method requires you to click all the links on your blog.

A Broken Link Checker plugin is also available. You should use the plugin at regular intervals.

If you don’t want to use the plugin, you can use automated tools like:

Google Search Console and Google Analytics reveal links that caused 404 errors on a WordPress blog.

Screaming Frog is also an online tool to find broken links. Download it from the website and install it. Just enter the website URL and start. It will produce a list of links.

Fix Internal Broken Links

Remove the link. If the page has been deleted, delete the link to it too.
In case the link URL is misspelled, please correct it. If any page is moved, redirect the link to the new page.

Now you have solved the problem for the internal links. But sometimes these pages link are also pointed by external website sources. For that, you have to set up 301 redirects. For that you can use The Redirection plugin, It is a useful tool for setting 301

It’s important to remember that if you delete or change the page, you must remove the URL from the Google search console and add a new URL, To ensure that traffic is not sent to broken links. To remove a broken link, Open the Google search console and click ‘Remove’, then paste the URL.

Respond to the visitor’s comment.

It is a good practice to respond to visitor comments. When someone sees an answer to a comment, they feel good about the blog and get the impression that you care about the visitors. This is beneficial for the user’s experience. It also indicates that you are attached to the user. Although SEO is not directly improved by comments, but it has a significant indirect impact.

Eliminating Spam Comments and Examine Your Spam Filters.

Eliminating Spam Comments is also factor of WordPress maintenance. Your readers could experience a negative impact from these spam comments. This is not good for search engine optimization, according to Google.

Additionally, it slows down your WordPress blog.

During the process of responding to comments, it is possible to remove spam comments. if you’ve received a lot of comments, spending hours trying to figure out what is or isn’t spam is not a good idea . It is also frustrating.

Deactivating the comments section is a possible solution, but it will disconnect communication with your readers. It will solve one problem, but it will also generate another.

Use of Anti-spam plugins.

A spam filter is available to deal with the problem of spam. Akismet is a spam plugin for WordPress. You need to change its setting to prevent real reviews from being deleted and lost.

Jetpack, Antispam Bee, and Anti-spam are among the other plugins that can prevent spam.

The problem of spam filter

Genuine comments can be flagged as spam by spam filters because plugins are not perfect. Just because they wrote something that is generally not expected.
Spam filters recognize spam comments based on certain algorithms. So they can sometimes filter some genuine comments if it recognizes something unexpected in the comments.
We need to verify if a genuine item is being filtered as spam. If that’s the case, move them from the spam folder to the comments by approving them.

After examining the spam folder, remove all spam comments. Otherwise, if you come back before the spam folder automatically empty, you have to recheck the old spam.

Optimize Your WordPress Database.

What is Data optimization

Data optimization is also a WordPress maintenance task. It helps to increase the speed of the website, which is ultimately a good factor for SEO.
When you install WordPress, it creates a new database, and as time passes, it stores posts, comments, plugins, and theme settings data and metadata.
Sometimes we edit posts, WordPress creates a new, updated copy of the post but it also resides old copies in the database. Now old post copies sit in the database while new post revisions are live on blog. These old post copies clutter our database.
Apart from that old plugin that are not in use also has their settings and metadata in the database and is not used, which also clutters the database.
Spam comments also reside in the database. The database also contains trash, transient options, orphaned metadata, and so on.
All this useless data clutters our database. Removing this data from a database is called data optimization.

The benefit of data optimization.

All this junk data in the database increases the size of the database and decreases the performance of the search, writing, and reading operations in the system. As a result, it slows down your WordPress blog.
Also, it increases the backup size. So we need more space to store backups, and a bigger database size also consumes more time for backup and restore.
By optimizing the database, we can improve our WordPress blog’s speed, which helps to improve our SEO ranking. In addition to this, we can also save time and database space.

Optimization of the Data Base

Before implementing the database optimization, it’s very mandatory to create a complete WordPress backup. Otherwise, you may be at risk of losing all your data.
For data optimization, you can install a plugin. There are several plugins for database optimization.
A few examples are:
The WP-Optimize plugin has been developed by the team that developed the popular plugin UpdraftPlus for backup.
Its settings are easy, just install, activate, set options according to your needs, and run.

You can also set a post-revision limit smaller, to avoid having a large number of old posts stored before the next database optimization.

Revise and Update the content of the blog.

It is also an essential component of the WordPress maintenance task.
It’s mandatory to update your content as new information becomes available. If visitors see up-to-date information, they will come back to your blog, which is a positive sign. It’s beneficial for SEO because Google will update your content in the cache and label it as active.

Updating your blog is equally valuable as uploading new content. It’s crucial to maintain your ranking on the Google search page. This is time-consuming but less than creating new content.
In the end, I will suggest that having less content is better than having outdated content. So update your blog content regularly

Delete Junk files which are not in use.

sometimes we have files that are no longer in use, as images, old themes files, uninstalled plugins files, etc. Such useless files consume our hosting space.

Regularly deleting images and videos from the media library is necessary, otherwise they will accumulate significantly. At some point, it will be difficult for you to determine which files are in use or not. As soon as you discover that the file is not in use, delete the files.

When you delete posts, pages, and comments they go to the trash folder. by default, they stay there for thirty days. If you don’t want them you can delete them. But it is difficult to empty manually every time. For that, You can also decrease the span of time to keep these files in the trash. So it automatically deleted for you for set intervals.

title.rendered: How To Add Meta Tags In WordPress Without Plugin

content.rendered:
In this article, we will explain the step-by-step method:  To add meta tags in WordPress without plugin. In this method, meta tags will be generated uniquely for each post page according to the article. As we know that WordPress does not contain keywords and description meta tag data in the default installation.  In this article, we will explain How To Add Meta Tags In WordPress Without Plugin.

what are Meta tags?

HTML Meta tags are used to provide information about data on web pages to search engines. HTML meta tags are written inside the head section of the HTML page. We can not see Meta tags on the web page, they reside in source code and provide information to search engines about the page.

Meta Tags SEO Importance

Meta Tags SEO is very important for our website or blog to get more traffic. The main meta tags important for SEO are meta description and meta keywords. Meta description helps to describe our content on SERPs. Visitors read Meta’s description and click our page link. Meta description helps to increase our CTR. Meta Keywords also meta tags which include some tags about our page. Meta Keywords helps search engines to understand our content.

How HTML Meta Tags Description Improve Web Traffic.

When a user searches on google, google lists about 10 organic results per page. Some pages may have fewer results. In the search result, google display the title and description of the post page. So if the meta tags description is to the point and expresses a solution for the viewer’s problem, it will increase the chance that the viewer will click the link of the post or article. So meta description is very important to impress the viewer to click your website or blog post link. Now it is clear meta tag descriptions are important to improve SEO indirectly.

Best Methods to Add the Meta Tag Description to WordPress.

Meta tag can be added manually, by adding code to the Theme template files, or through WordPress Plugins.

Adding meta tag descriptions manually or using code to generate meta tag reduce the number of plugins in your WordPress blog, as a result, it improves WordPress speed. It also provides flexibility to add meta tags. But adding meta tag descriptions for each page, for a large site is a very tedious job.

So here we will show you a method to generate unique meta tag descriptions automatically for each post, using code in your WordPress blog . 

How does this code generate a unique meta tag description for each post?

This code will automatically generate meta tag descriptions from your first paragraph of the post. The paragraph’s first 160 words are taken into account.

Google search results display a description that is approximately 150 to 160 words. It’s important to provide concise information that explains the article’s purpose in the first 150 to 200 words. Write in such a way that grabs the viewer’s attention.

By doing so, you can attract viewers to click on your link and increase your CTR.

Steps: How To Add Meta Tags In WordPress Without Plugin

If you do not know the technicalities of WordPress themes don’t worry just follow the steps. It is an easy guide to add code for meta tag description.

1. Accessing the Theme Files Editor in WordPress Dashboard.

In the left sidebar search for appearance and hover on it and then click “Theme File Editor”, steps are mentioned in the image below.

2. Locating the Header.php File and Inserting code for Meta Tags

Now find the header.php file in the right sidebar under the Theme Files title. Now you will see code in the editor in the dashboard’s center. Insert new code, between section, new code is highlighted, as shown in the image below.

Copy the following code and insert in header.php

<?php
	if ( is_singular() ) {
	    $post_des = strip_tags( $post->post_content );
	    $post_des = strip_shortcodes( $post->post_content );
	    $post_des = str_replace( array("\n", "\r", "\t","<p>","</p>","<strong>","</strong>"," ","<!-- wp:paragraph -->","<!-- /wp:paragraph -->","  "), ' ', $post_des );
		
        $post_des = mb_substr( $post_des, 0, 220, 'utf8' );
		echo '<meta name="description" content="' . $post_des . '" />' . "\n";
    }
    if ( is_home() ) {
        echo '<meta name="description" content="' . get_bloginfo( "description" ) . '" />' . "\n";
    }
    if ( is_category() ) {
        $cat_des = strip_tags(category_description());
        echo '<meta name="description" content="' . $cat_des . '" />' . "\n";
    }
	?>

Now click “Update File”. Don’t forget to update the file, otherwise, the change will be lost.

Conclusion

Meta tag description is very important in search engine result pages. It helps a lot to improve the CTR of the WordPress blog page. In this article, we have explained, how to add code in WordPress to generate meta tag descriptions automatically.

title.rendered: How to Hide Author Name in Blog Posts on WordPress

content.rendered:
In this article, we will show three methods to hide Author Name in the blog post. You can use anyone, you find helpful.
Sometimes it is required to hide the author’s name in WordPress blog posts. The reason for hiding the name is that sometimes individual blogger doesn’t want to show their name.
There are three ways to hide the author’s name. You can use anyone which suits you. In the first method, we will use a plugin and in the second and third we will hide the author’s name manually.

1. Use a WordPress plugin to hide author name

If you don’t want to edit the theme files manually and don’t want to go into technical details, then the easy way for you is to use the plugin.

1. Go to Plugin Section in WordPress Dashboard

Open the WordPress dashboard and search for the plugin in the left sidebar. Now Click “Add New”.

2. Next click Add New

At the top of the dashboard panel find the button “Add New”. Now click the button “Add New”.

3 Plugin Search and Installation

In the plugin search box, write and search for “hide author name”. Search will show many plugins to hide user metadata. Find plugin Hide/Remove Metadata. It is a free plugin. After searching plugin click “Install Now”. It takes a few seconds to install the plugin, after installation click Activate.

4. Settings of Hide/Remove Metadata Plugin

After installing we have to change the setting whether we want to use CSS or PHP to hide the author’s name. We can also choose whether to hide only the author’s name or publish date also. After doing settings don’t forget to save changes by clicking “Save Changes”. You can see all steps in the image below.

Now you can check the Author’s name and Publish date in the blog post.

Sometimes we don’t want to add plugins in WordPress. The reason may be that we don’t want to make our WordPress heavy. Sometimes plugins do not work with custom-made themes where the name of CSS elements is different.
For that, we have more two methods where we can hide the author’s name manually. One is to add additional CSS and the other is to edit theme files

2. Hide Author name Manually Using Additional CSS

If you don’t have little knowledge of CSS and HTML, just follow the steps it is very easy.

Search Customize tab.

In the WordPress dashboard search for Appearance in the left sidebar, then in the pop-up menu click Customize.

It will take you to the next step.

Search Additional CSS tab

Now Click “Additional CSS” at the bottom of the left sidebar.

Adding CSS code

Now you have to paste CSS code to hide the author name. This code will hide the Class which contains the author’s name.

.entry-meta .author {
 display: none;
 }

Now copy this code and paste it as shown in the below image.

if you want to hide Publish date you can also paste the next code.

.entry-meta .entry-date {
display: none;
}

Now click the Publish Button, to activate the code. Don’t forget to click Publish button, otherwise, it will not save and work.

In rare cases, it does not work. In such a situation you have to check the correct name of classes that contain the author’s name. Sometimes .entry-meta and .author classes may have different names or be organized in different ways in your custom themes. You can find their correct name using the browser developer tool.

3. Hide Author’s name by Editing the Theme file

Now change $disable_author == 0 to $disable_author == 1
if you want to hide publish date you can change the line
$disable_date == 0 to $disable_date == 1.
Sometimes you do not find all these codes then you have only the option to Comment out or Delete the code which contains the author’s name. You can search terms like ( Published by, author, author-name class, etc. ) and remove or Comment out the code that includes the author’s name.
